Long-running comedy series, starring Frank Thornton, Jean Fergusson and Robert Fyfe

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine

However, when they re-examine the case of a man whose conviction for murder 20 years ago has just been overturned, their combined experience and unorthodox methods bring interesting results. Alun Armstrong, Dennis Waterman and James Bolam play Redman's veteran team, with Jon Finch, Tim Woodwork and Philip Bretherton

programme.desc: The first of two final cases for the detective, played by Martin Shaw. Gently is on the brink of retirement when he, Bacchus and Coles re-open the case of a woman convicted of killing her husband, hoping to uncover a long-buried miscarriage of justice. However, the investigation places Gently's career on the line and stirs up tension with Bacchus, who worked on the original investigation

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries

programme.title: The Split
programme.desc: Acclaimed Centre Forward Diallo Diopo is in Noble & Hale as Hannah is representing his fiance in their pre-nup. Christie excitedly talks his way in to the negotiations, but is thrown when he realises that the opposing - heavily pregnant - lawyer is his ex-wife, Lauren Brooker. Elsewhere, Ruth and Oscar clash head on as she demands he stay away from her girls. It's clear he has no intention of listening to her. Abi Morgan's drama, starring Nicola Walker, Stephen Mangan and Deborah Findlay

programme.title: Miss Marple
programme.desc: Feature-length episode of the drama. A couple wake up to find a strangled corpse on the hearthrug in their library - but help is at hand in the diminutive form of venerable amateur sleuth Miss Marple, who just happens to live next door. She agrees to investigate but, as her inquiries get under way, another body is discovered. Joan Hickson, Gwen Watford and Moray Watson star

programme.title: The Bill

programme.title: The Bill

programme.title: The Bill

programme.title: The Bill

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: As spring arrives, Nonnatus House welcomes two new nuns, the experienced Sister Hilda and newly qualified Sister Frances, who must acclimatise to the changing East End. A complicated multiple birth tests the skills of some of the midwives to the limit, but Trixie has to face her fears and Valerie deals with a shocking case that arrives unexpectedly

programme.title: Dickensian
programme.desc: Period drama re-imagining the works of Charles Dickens as inter-connected tales, set in a fictional version of 19th-century London. The likes of Oliver Twist's Fagin and the Artful Dodger live alongside and interact with the wealthy Barbarys of Bleak House, and the homely Cratchitts of A Christmas Carol, in events that eventually set up the stories featured in their respective novels. The saga begins on Christmas Eve, as Amelia and Arthur Havisham gather to hear the reading of their father's will, and the ruthless nature of debt collector Jacob Marley appears to give someone a motive for murder. Starring Stephen Rea, Pauline Collins, Caroline Quentin, Tom Weston-Jones, Tuppence Middleton, Anton Lesser and Omid Djalili

programme.title: Dickensian
programme.desc: Christmas Day arrives and news of Jacob Marley's murder dampens the festivities, giving Inspector Bucket a new investigation to pursue. Meanwhile, at Satis House, Amelia Havisham's mysterious rescuer makes another appearance. Period drama, weaving together the back-stories of some of Dickens' various tales, starring Stephen Rea, Tuppence Middleton and Ben Starr

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's A Dinner of Herbs
programme.desc: First in a two-part drama, starring Billie Whitelaw as a herbalist who takes an 11-year-old orphan under her wing. programme.title: Sister Boniface Mysteries
programme.desc: Sister Boniface and her father play a dangerous game when they investigate suspicions of espionage at a chess tournament

programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.desc: When leading fashion designer Marco Bergman commits suicide, his son Claude sets out to shatter the cosy world view of feature writer Donna Henry, who savaged him in print, by appearing to change identity before her eyes. The unconventional sleuth attempts to find a rational explanation for this apparent miracle and is drawn into an even more puzzling mystery involving a drawer full of socks and a parrot called Harvey. Offbeat detective drama, guest starring Maureen Lipman and Bill Bailey

programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.desc: Professional sceptic Justin Mallory, who dedicated his life to debunking fraudulent paranormal phenomena, dies in a tragic boating accident. But when his body mysteriously disappears and his lover Geraldine claims his spirit has been trying to contact her, it seems only Jonathan Creek and sidekick Carla Borrego are able to lay his ghost to rest. Offbeat mystery, starring Alan Davies and Julia Sawalha.

programme.title: Whitechapel
programme.desc: Part one of two. A dangerous patient and former Whitechapel resident escapes from a psychiatric unit around the same time a babysitter is murdered. With the area becoming the focus of a series of terrifying events in quick succession, Chandler's quest to bring in a suspect alive jeopardises his relationship with Miles. Two-part series finale, starring Rupert Penry-Jones and Phil Davis

programme.title: Whitechapel
programme.desc: Part two of two. With the body count rising, Miles and Chandler clash over the direction of the investigation, and struggle to put aside their differences in the face of their toughest adversary to date. Counsellor Morgan Lamb is of particular interest to the team, having already survived the killer's wrath, and Chandler has a vested interest in keeping her alive. Starring Rupert Penry-Jones, Phil Davis and Lydia Leonard

programme.title: Luther
programme.desc: The detective is a broken man after being accused of crimes he hasn't committed and is forced to work outside the law in an attempt to catch vigilante killer Marwood, who has made his vendetta personal by targeting Luther and those closest to him. As Stark hurries Mary into hiding for her own protection - hoping to lure the detective into a trap - the man himself continues his private investigation, realising that the killer won't be satisfied until he has punished the man responsible for his wife's death - and when he kidnaps an innocent woman, the stage is set for a dramatic showdown in which Luther is forced to make an impossible decision. Idris Elba stars as the maverick cop, with Sienna Guillory, Elliot Cowan and David O'Hara

programme.title: Broken
programme.desc: As the repercussions of Christina's actions start to hit home, Father Michael makes a discovery and must act fast to help her justify what happened to the authorities and her sister, Mariella. Meanwhile, new parishioner Roz attends confession to share a huge secret, prompting the priest to share a dark confession of his own in an attempt to dissuade her from the desperate course of action she has planned. The two share a connection, but is it wise for Father Michael to confide his own secrets to someone struggling to deal with their own?

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Valerie helps mother of five Betty come to terms with her sixth child's birth defect. The Turners oversee a measles vaccination trial at the clinic, but are concerned by an overly anxious first-time mother. They soon discover she is concealing a devastating loss, which could have serious repercussions. Nurse Crane decides to bring a taste of the seaside to Poplar for the Whitsun bank holiday, and Violet's political career goes from strength to strength as she wins the seat on the council for Poplar North

Angus loves to barbeque and entertain friends so would like a generous Cypriot-inspired space in which to do that and is also keen to try to grow his own produce. As usual, the participants set out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory, through rounds such as Home Truths and Quick-fire Lies

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: When Lee and Lucy are asked to cover for Anna on more than one occasion so she can go out at night for secret Italian lessons, they suspect the worst - that she is having an affair. Lee decides it is up to him to tell Toby that his marriage is in jeopardy and sets about finding the evidence. Comedy, starring Lee Mack, Sally Bretton, Abigail Cruttenden and Hugh Dennis

programme.title: Queen of Oz
programme.desc: When word gets out that Georgie has been sleeping with one of her staff, she fixes the problem by firing her 'boytoy' Augustus. Georgiana is excited to anticipate her face on the new Australian $5 notes, but when Zoe realises she approved the wrong - and unflattering - portrait, the staff goes into damage control. Hoping to alleviate her constant and ruthless coverage on Steele News, Georgie invites CEO Richard Steele to dinner with the plan to charm him. Matthew suggests she tell Steele she shares his love of hunting, but this plan quickly backfires. Comedy, starring Catherine Tate

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Glastonbury
programme.desc: The Sheffield band perform on the Pyramid stage, their third time headlining the festival and a decade on from their last appearance. Following a huge sold-out world tour and armed with their recent seventh studio album The Car, they are likely to be one of the talking points of this year's event. Songs likely to be performed include Brianstorm, Fluorescent Adolescent, R U Mine? and I Bet That You Look Good on the Dancefloor. Introduced by Jo Whiley and Clara Amfo

programme.title: The Miseducation of Cameron Post (2018)
programme.desc: After teenager Cameron is caught in the backseat of a car with the prom queen, she is sent away to a treatment centre in a remote area called God's Promise. While being subjected to questionable gay conversion therapies, she bonds with fellow residents as they pretend to go along with the process while waiting to be released. Drama, starring Chloe Grace Moretz and John Gallagher Jr

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt is joined by chefs Ching-He Huang and Mike Reid, plus special guest Danny Jones. Helen McGinn picks the wines to go with the studio dishes

programme.title: Nadiya Bakes
programme.desc: Nadiya Hussain shares her love of baking with some of her favourite recipes, from every day treats to indulgent desserts. In the second episode, Nadiya shares recipes for her most indulgent desserts, from frozen blueberry and banana cheesecake to husband's favourite jam roly poly. Later, Nadiya also shares her tips and tricks for her picture perfect tutti frutti pavlova

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Properties in Sevenoaks in Kent, Beeston in Nottinghamshire and Dalston in east London are sold at auction. Presenters including Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell report on progress as these varied projects encounter unexpected twists and turns

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Tennis: Queen's
programme.desc: The cinch Championships. Clare Balding presents coverage of day six of the men's grass-court tournament at Queen's Club, featuring the singles semi-finals. Both matches at the corresponding stage of last year's tournament were settled in straight sets, with Filip Krajinovic beating Marin Cilic 6-3 6-3, and Matteo Berrettini recording a 6-4 6-3 victory over Botic van de Zandschulp

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: The Hit List
programme.desc: Marvin and Rochelle Humes present a celebrity edition of the music-based quiz show, featuring DJ Chris Moyles and actor James Buckley, Radio 1 DJs Rickie Haywood-Williams and Charlie Hedges, and sports star Sam Quek and presenter Martel Maxwell. The three teams must name as many hit songs and artists as possible under intense pressure, with a ¬£10,000 jackpot for charity up for grabs

programme.title: Michael McIntyre's The Wheel
programme.desc: The comedian hosts the Saturday-night gameshow, in which contestants take on a colossal spinning wheel and answer questions in the hope of securing a cash prize. Tonight's expert celebrity advice comes from Dermot O'Leary on fish, Nicola Adams on boxing, Alexander Armstrong on classical music, Denise Van Outen on the 1990s, Olly Smith on wine, Gloria Hunniford on Hollywood icons, and Rhys Stephenson on children's TV

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman present a star-studded version of the general knowledge quiz. Rick Edwards, Emer Kenny, Danny Wallace, Yuriko Kotani, Ian Waite, Vincent Simone, Russ Bray and Deta Hedman try to come up with the least likely correct answers to a series of questions posed to members of the public

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Faith hurriedly tries to hide her pills when she is interrupted by Luka and his friend Johnny - who later has a fit. She rushes the boy to ED, assuming he has taken the pills, and is quick to admit the possibility of an overdose. However, there may be other medical issues she is not aware of, with potentially disastrous consequences. Rida investigates a mystery, Jacob starts to doubt his relationship, and Sah receives news about their surgery

programme.title: Glastonbury
programme.desc: Clara Amfo introduces two of the biggest pop artists on the planet performing on the Pyramid Stage. First up is Lewis Capaldi, who performed last month at Radio 1 Big Weekend in Dundee, and recently scored his second number one album Broken By Desire to Be Heavenly Sent. Following Capaldi on the Pyramid Stage is Grammy award-winning US pop star Lizzo, who returns to Worthy Farm after her triumphant 2019 set

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Misbehaviour (2020)
programme.desc: It's 1970, and Bob Hope is due to host the Miss World beauty pageant in London, one of the most watched shows in the world. However, the organisers, and the Hollywood star, do not count on the newly formed women's liberation movement, who plan to disrupt the controversial ceremony. Director Philippa Lowthorpe's comedy drama, starring Keira Knightley, Gugu Mbatha-Raw and Jessie Buckley

programme.title: NBA Finals Highlights
programme.desc: A review of the series between Denver Nuggets and Miami Heat, which decided this year's NBA champions

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Sunday with Laura Kuenssberg
programme.desc: Interviews with key politicians and public figures

programme.title: Politics London
programme.desc: The latest political news and debate from the region

programme.title: Sunday Morning Live
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher and Holly Hamilton present topical debate covering religious, moral and ethical issues, with guest panellists and contributions from viewers

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: At Detling antiques fair in Kent, Caroline Hawley and Raj Bisram take charge of the teams while Natasha Raskin Sharp takes a tour of one family's collection of novelty teapots

programme.title: Points of View
programme.desc: Viewers' opinions on BBC shows and behind-the-scenes reports on new programmes

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Aled Jones discovers how the roots of Christianity on the Isle of Man stretch back over 1500 years, and meets a Christian shepherdess to hear about a rewilding initiative

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Tennis: Queen's
programme.desc: The cinch Championships. Coverage of the men's singles final in the grass-court tournament at Queen's Club. Italy's Matteo Berrettini prevailed 7-5, 6-4 over Filip Krajinovic of Serbia in last year's showpiece match to lift this trophy for the second year running. The feat put him in good company, with former world number ones Lleyton Hewitt, Andy Roddick and Andy Murray the other players to have won this title two or more times in a row this century

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and Harry and David Rich transform a garden in Bournemouth for young married couple Thomas and Rhiann. They have a budget of ¬£3,000 to create a shady, flower-filled space in their sunny back garden and Tom has a lifelong dream of putting in a massive koi carp pond

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Glastonbury
programme.desc: Lauren Laverne presents two more of today's performances from the Pyramid Stage. Rick Astley makes his Glastonbury debut with a mass singalong of 1980s hits, while New York punk pop legends Blondie will be taking to the stage with classic numbers from their five decade long career

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Adam Henson celebrates the 50th anniversary of the Rare Breed Survival Trust, a charity founded by his father to reverse the decline of rare breed numbers in the UK. With summer temperatures rising, Adam welcomes a shearing gang on site to remove the coats of his commercial sheep, and is visited by the Chief Executive of the British Pig Association. Plus, a Gloucester Bull is prepared for a day at a country show

programme.title: Spy in the Ocean
programme.desc: The final episode explores the challenges that ocean life must overcome, including baby elephant seals and humpback whales endangered as their mothers end up surrounded by males vying for supremacy. A lone sealion chases tuna, one of the fastest fish in the ocean. Not only must it find a way of catching this enormous fish, but it must do so whilst fighting off hungry sharks

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce hosts from Woodhorn Museum in Northumberland. Treasures brought in to be valued include a gold Rolex 'President' wristwatch from the 1980s and a grotesque ceramic animal sculpture made by the eccentric Martin Brothers. Suzanne Zack is enchanted by a beautifully rendered pencil portrait by British artist Henry Ryland, while John Foster falls for a small Roman figure uncovered by a metal detectorist. Plus, Fiona learns tells the story of coal mining and the miners' way of life in the north-east of England

programme.title: Glastonbury
programme.desc: Clara Amfo, Lauren Laverne, Jack Saunders and Jo Whiley present the historic final performance of this year's festival, as Elton John makes his Glastonbury debut with a set that also marks the last show of his final UK tour. With a career of hits spanning over five decades, it's guaranteed to be a spectacular and emotional swan song to one of the world's greatest showmen

programme.title: Tulip Fever (2017)
programme.desc: In 17th-century Amsterdam at the height of tulip mania, an artist falls in love with a married woman whose portrait he has been commissioned to paint. Historical romance based on Deborah Moggach's novel, starring Alicia Vikander, Dane DeHaan and Jack O'Connell

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph patrols Altrincham recycling centre in Greater Manchester, hoping to find three items packed with potential and give them the chance to shine once more. She finds a pair of folding chairs, an old washstand and a collection of glass bottles. Upholsterer Simion Hawtin-Smith and upcycler Sarah Parmenter set to work helping Jacqui transform her finds

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: The team arrives in Kent to help a busy family of four whose members have recently converted their garage into a wet room, but now lack storiage room. In just 24 hours and on a limited budget, they convert the original downstairs toilet into a store cupboard and build clever seat storage in the family room

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost visits a walled garden in Somerset to meet volunteers who are gardening alongside those who need help to transform their lives. At Longmeadow, Monty Don creates two different planting schemes for pots for shady spaces, transplants grasses in the jewel garden and plants out his favourite varieties of tomatoes. And Rachel de Thame revels in the seasonal displays of Azaleas in Shropshire

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Calls on the day's talking points, with views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 (calls are free from mobiles and landlines)

programme.title: Politics UK
programme.desc: The week's political proceedings around the UK

programme.title: Tennis: Queen's
programme.desc: The cinch Championships. Clare Balding presents coverage of day five of the men's grass-court tournament at Queen's Club, featuring the singles quarter-finals. Filip Krajinovi ended any hopes of a British winner last year when he came back from a set down to overcome Ryan Peniston. His second-round opponent was confirmed as two-time champion Marin Cilic, who won in straight sets against Emil Ruusuvuori. In the other half of the draw, there were victories for Botic van de Zandschulp and reigning champion Matteo Berrettini against Alejandro Davidovich Fokina and Tommy Paul respectively

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Former winners Rickie Haywood-Williams, Sally Phillips, Vikki Stone and Dan Walker make a final bid for victory before Richard Osman announces the week's winner

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his post-war exploration of northwest England in Bradford, Shipley and Hebden Bridge. In Bradford's Centenary Square, he encounters local literary giant, JB Priestley. At Shipley station, Michael discovers a nature reserve in the middle of the car park. Finally the Calder Valley Line delivers the presenter to the photogenic station at Hebden Bridge

programme.title: Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: Wildflowers and houseplants are at the heart of this week's show. Carole Baxter visits the garden of a specialist in the sowing and cultivation of wildflowers. Kirsty Wilson upcycles a second-hand cabinet and turns it into a display case for houseplants, complete with specialist lighting

programme.title: Glastonbury
programme.desc: Lauren Laverne and Clara Amfo are live at Glastonbury Festival as the first full day of music gets going. They introduce performances by Glasgow band Texas, who return to the Pyramid Stage for the first time since 1999, and Los Angeles trio Gabriels, who take to the West Holts Stage. Plus, special guests, and there is an intimate performance in the park studio

programme.title: Glastonbury
programme.desc: Clara Amfo and Jo Whiley gear up to welcome the first headliner of the weekend in the form Arctic Monkeys, while Jack Saunders reports from the Pyramid Stage pit, soaking up all the excitement ahead of their highly anticipated third headline performance at the festival. Clara and Jo introduce music from the likes of Brighton duo Royal Blood on the Pyramid Stage, as well as Los Angeles indie rockers Warpaint, enigmatic duo Sparks, and Scottish trio Young Fathers

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories, presented by Kirsty Wark

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts an extended edition of the quiz, with Ed Byrne, Cally Beaton, Jack Dee and Alan Davies answering theatre-themed questions

programme.title: Live at the Apollo Bites
programme.desc: Highlights from the stand-up comedy showcase, featuring performances from Tom Allen, Jess Fostekew and Mawaan Rizwan

programme.title: Glastonbury
programme.desc: Jo Whiley and Jack Saunders look back at highlights from the other headline acts of the evening, including US superstar Kelis. Swedish experimental synth-pop purveyor Fever Ray, and Hot Chip on the newly named Woodsies Stage. There's also a chance to see some of the special moments from the first 24 hours

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Around one in seven in the UK now takes an antidepressant. Globally they have made the pharmaceutical industry billions. When the current generation of drugs was launched 35 years ago, they promised a safe and effective treatment, free from the side effects of older medicines. But have they lived up to those claims? Whilst many people say they have benefited from taking them, Panorama reveals evidence of some companies trying to conceal concerns about their drugs and follows patients who've suffered serious side effects as they continue their fight to be heard

programme.title: Once Upon a Time in Northern Ireland
programme.desc: A look at how the conflict became an intelligence war, as the police and the army made efforts to infiltrate paramilitary organisations and recruit informers. Anne Marie reveals how a loyalist gun attack at a funeral in Milltown Cemetery in West Belfast in 1988 prompted her to plant firebombs in city centre shops, primed to explode at night. She then became caught up in an intelligence web of informers and interrogation.

programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The squirrels want to keep a Scrufflelump as a pet

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Tag gets lost in the lost property room

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Evil Pea and Supertato get stuck inside a giant bubble

programme.title: Shaun the Sheep
programme.desc: Bitzer has to wear the cone of shame

programme.title: Dennis & Gnasher Unleashed!
programme.desc: JJ is faced with a dilemma

programme.title: Boy Girl Dog Cat Mouse Cheese
programme.desc: Boy and Dog work on their comedy act for a talent show

programme.title: The Deep
programme.desc: Jeffrey must dive to the rescue to save Devil Daniels and his pet fish Bethany

programme.title: OOglies Funsize
programme.desc: Pete Parsnip comes face to face with a terrifying snake

programme.title: Game on Grandparents
programme.desc: Akaal and his grandad Perminder go head-to-head with Nasri and her grandmother Jennill in Mario Golf as they compete for the chance to make it to the Grand Final

programme.title: One Zoo Three
programme.desc: Tyler makes gummy treats for the pigmy marmosets

programme.title: Newsround
programme.desc: Current affairs reports aimed at a younger audience

programme.title: Blue Peter
programme.desc: The team gears up for the Glastonbury festival

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: Steve Backshall heads to Bali for a diving adventure to find a giant ocean sunfish

programme.title: Pooch Perfect
programme.desc: The first set of quarter-finalists take on a traditional dog groom when they gently removing the dead hairs from the coat of one of the UK's oldest breeds, the Welsh terrier, before producing a very modern look for the Dogwalk that requires smiley faces, flared legs and little outfits. Plus, in a new challenge, the contestants' knowledge of crossbreeds is put to the test as they try to identify a dog's parents. Presented by Sheridan Smith, with judges Verity Hardcastle and Colin Taylor

programme.title: Undiscovered Worlds with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: The naturalist explores some of the world's most dangerous environments, beginning with a journey to the Arctic. The objective is to discover how rising temperatures are affecting the environment, wildlife and the local people. Steve begins his expedition on the east coast of Greenland, where he assembles a team of experts to join him. The first stage of the journey involves kayaking across the world's largest fjord, with the explorers braving lethal and ever shifting sea ice, vast icebergs and hungry polar bears

programme.title: Family Cooking Showdown
programme.desc: With one of the teams fast-tracked through to tomorrow's final, there are just two families left fighting for the other place. To prove they have what it takes, they face two challenges - preparing and cooking a lamb rib centrepiece, with complementary side dishes, and creating the ultimate children's birthday cake. Then it's decision time for judges Angellica Bell and Tommy Banks

programme.title: The Best Dishes Ever
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott introduces a selection of recipes from the BBC archives for party food, including Lorraine Pascale's white chocolate lollipops, seafood dishes by James Martin and Rachel Khoo's coq-au-vin on a stick

programme.title: The Long, Hot Summer (1958)
programme.desc: A drifter fleeing persecution winds up in a town dominated by a powerful businessman, who takes a liking to the stranger and offers him a job. Despairing of his son's lack of ambition, the businessman plots to marry the new arrival to his daughter in the hope they will provide him with an heir. Drama, starring Paul Newman, Orson Welles and Joanne Woodward

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: A portrait of the wildlife living on the Dragon Mountains in South Africa, charting the fortunes of baboons, vultures and jackals as they survive on the slopes. Facing constant challenges from birth, the eland antelope climb high to find food, but must avoid wildfires, freezing rain and starvation along the way

programme.title: Your Home Made Perfect
programme.desc: Angela Scanlon presents the property makeover show in which cutting-edge virtual reality and visual effects enable people to see what their home could look like, before it is built in reality. Architects Will Foster and Julian McIntosh compete to remodel Yesim and Hasan's 1920s semi-detached house in Enfield, north London. The couple have had the house four years, but despite major renovation they have not managed to inject their personality into it and are struggling with a disconnected layout

programme.title: Glastonbury
programme.desc: Clara Amfo, Lauren Laverne, Jack Saunders and Jo Whiley present live coverage of the festival from Worthy Farm. Artists expected to feature include singer Raye, who makes her Glastonbury debut on the Pyramid Stage, and musical polymath Jacob Collier on the West Holts Stage. There are also a couple of intimate performances live in the Park Studio and two short films following contemporary classical composer Max Richter and 1980s icon Rick Astley

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig looks at all things shaky and shady with Alan Davies, Eshaan Akbar, John Barrowman and Victoria Coren Mitchell

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: Angela Barnes plays host in this show recorded before a packed house at London's Hammersmith Apollo, warming up the audience and then introducing routines by fellow comedians Sarah Keyworth and Tim Renkow

programme.title: Glastonbury
programme.desc: Lauren Laverne and Jack Saunders introduce coverage of the rock band's headline performance on the Pyramid Stage. Lauren and Clara Amfo also round up the highlights of the day, including Fat Boy Slim headlining the Park Stage, and Christine and the Queens at the Woodsies, as well as a performance in the studio by Say She She

programme.title: Good Morning Karachi (2013)
programme.desc: A Pakistani woman working at a beauty salon is given the chance to pursue her dream of becoming a model. Her pursuit of the goal is frowned upon by both her mother and her fiance, and threatened by rising social tensions as the country prepares for an election. Drama based on Shandana Minhas' novel Rafina, starring Amna Ilyas and Beo Raana Zafar. In Urdu and English

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost shares the results of his wild meadow turf experiment. In North Yorkshire, Nick Bailey discovers the range of floral beauty of Cornus Kousa, the dog wood tree. And Toby Buckland visits a back garden near Milton Keynes with seven ponds

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: In an episode celebrating the 50th anniversary of the Welsh Surfing Federation, John Craven meets Linda Sharp, the UK's first female European champion who helped shape e Welsh surfing culture in the 1970s. He also joins Swansea's Surfers Against Sewage at one of their monthly beach cleans. Margherita Taylor discovers the magical landscape of the Kenfig sand dune system, Joe Crowley explores how nature could be threatened by the UK's growing demand for water, and Adam Henson catches up with young farmers

programme.title: Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: Wildflowers and houseplants are at the heart of this week's show. Carole Baxter visits the garden of a specialist in the sowing and cultivation of wildflowers. Kirsty Wilson upcycles a second-hand cabinet and turns it into a display case for houseplants, complete with specialist lighting

programme.title: Landward
programme.desc: In a weather-focused special, Dougie Vipond heads out into the North Sea to visit Scotland's biggest offshore wind farm as it nears completion, while Anne Lundon explores how the installation's impact on marine mammals is being monitored. Chris Blanchett finds out how a favourite summer treat is produced using the power of the sun in the north-east of Scotland

programme.title: The Edible Garden
programme.desc: Alys Fowler demonstrates how easy it is to grow raspberries and blueberries, and plants juicy fruits from which she then prepares jams and tangy fruit leathers. She also tries her hand at hapazome, a Japanese printing technique used to transfer flower and leaf shapes on to fabric

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt presents more highlights from the series, offering viewers a chance to revisit some of their favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen

programme.title: Family Cooking Showdown
programme.desc: The final sees the two remaining families tasked to create a three-course extravaganza fit for a most special of family celebrations, with canapes to start, two main courses and two puddings. As arbitrators Angellica Bell and Tommy Banks watch on, tension mounts between participants as they strive for perfection

programme.title: Clash of the Titans (1981)
programme.desc: A hero of ancient Greece vows to save a princess from being sacrificed to a ferocious sea monster. However, to defeat the creature he must first embark on a journey into the underworld and seize the head of the monstrous Medusa, whose gaze turns men to stone. Mythical adventure, starring Harry Hamlin, Laurence Olivier, Maggie Smith and Judi Bowker, with special effects by Ray Harryhausen

programme.title: Talking Pictures
programme.desc: Sylvia Syms narrates a look at the TV appearances made over the years by Oscar-winning actor Laurence Olivier, using rare material from the BBC archives to capture the highlights and milestones of his life and extraordinarily distinguished career

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: In Art Week, the sewers start by make a skirt inspired by the Modernist movement. In the transformation challenge, the contestants are given canvases painted by local art students and turn them into dresses, making use of the sculptural fabric and painted design. For the Made to Measure challenge, the sewers take inspiration from the 20th Century Surrealist movement to create fantastical outfits for a mind-bending catwalk

programme.title: Spy in the Ocean
programme.desc: Extraordinary relationships among the creatures of the ocean, from spider crabs watching each other's backs for predators while they shed their shells, to fish cleaning the skins and teeth of hammerhead sharks. Off the coast of Costa Rica, a team of spy cameras capture a megapod of spinner dolphins, numbering in their thousands, working together to drive the flying fish from below while tuna and frigate birds pursue them in the air

programme.title: Stanley Tucci: Searching for Italy
programme.desc: The actor heads to Sicily, where Michelin-starred chef Tony Lo Coco shows off his signature dish of spaghetti alla bottarga. Stanley also meets artisanal winemaker Arianna Occhipinti and tries the grapes grown in the region's unique soils, and dines with Princess Stefania di Raffadali in Palermo.

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: The team heads to Sandon Hall in Staffordshire, where Christina Trevanion and Charles Hanson find some treasures, while Paul Martin hears about pioneering local woman

programme.title: Glastonbury
programme.desc: Clara Amfo, Lauren Laverne and Jack Saunders present coverage of the final day of Glastonbury, including folk singer-songwriter Yusuf/Cat Stevens in the Legends slot. From the Other Stage, chart-topping pop singer Becky Hill makes her debut and there are a couple of live performances in the studio and an interview with members of Bristol Reggae Orchestra and the Windrush Choir, the opening act on the Pyramid Stage today

programme.title: Dunkirk (2017)
programme.desc: Allied soldiers from Belgium, the British Empire and France are surrounded by the German army, and face a tense wait for evacuation, during a fierce battle in northern France during the Second World War. Christopher Nolan's wartime drama, which he wrote, directed and produced, starring Kenneth Branagh, Tom Hardy, Mark Rylance and Fionn Whitehead

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: Jen Brister plays host in this show recorded before a packed house at London's Hammersmith Apollo, warming up the audience and then introducing routines by fellow comedians Esther Manito and Adam Rowe

programme.title: Glastonbury
programme.desc: As the festival comes to a close, Clara Amfo, Jack Saunders and Jo Whiley take a look back on a weekend of live music. They introduce highlights of the Sunday night headliners away from the Pyramid Stage, including French synthpoppers Phoenix on the Woodsies Stage, and London trio Rudimental at West Holts. There is one last unique intimate performance and the best moments from across the weekend

programme.title: LGBTQ+ Hits at the BBC
programme.desc: Performances by stars whose sex and sexuality is central to their careers and the songs they've created, including George Michael, Boy George, Freddie Mercury, Beth Ditto, MNEK, Lil Nas X and Barry Manilow. Some pushed boundaries and challenged gender stereotypes from the very start, while others only revealed their true selves after years of success and speculation, but all have played their part in changing the world of popular music

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the topical debate, inviting a panel of politicians and other guests in Clacton-on-Sea, Essex, to answer questions from an invited audience on subjects that have made the headlines over the past week

programme.title: Africa Rising with Afua Hirsch
programme.desc: Writer and broadcaster Afua Hirsch explores how young creatives are reinventing culture across Africa. She begins in Morocco, where she meets renowned photographer Hassan Hajjaj, who is updating traditional Moroccan style, goes riding with Tbourida horse rider Amal Amhari and explores Amazigh rug weaving with artist Sarah Allaoui. Afua also meets the country's new superstar singer Rym Fikri

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Today at the Test
programme.desc: England v Australia. Action from the second day of the one-off Women's Ashes Test, held at Trent Bridge in Nottingham. Australia have held the urn since 2015, winning three and drawing one of the last four series, but England will be hopeful of a competitive display in front of their own fans

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: The gardener explores Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, where particular olive trees planted by them are still grown today. Here Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections, as well as meeting up with the widow of English writer Gerald Durrell. She takes Monty up into the mountains on a wildflower trail

programme.title: Greece with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Part one of a two-part series in which the presenter takes a tour of the country, travelling from the islands of the Aegean to Athens. Along the way he meets local people including gun-toting priests and the last sponge-divers in the world, and discovers how they are coping with their country's current crises

programme.title: The Royle Family
programme.desc: Nana is staying with the family while she recuperates from her recent cataract operation and Barbara is anxious that Jim will hit the roof if she stays much longer. Antony is having love troubles, most of which are thanks to constant teasing from his family. When he finally storms off, the rest of the family are left blaming one another for who upset him most, all except Nana, who is fast asleep

programme.title: Classic Albums
programme.desc: Carly Simon talks about her 1972 album No Secrets, reflecting on her time with ex-husband James Taylor, a heroin addict when they first met. She also recounts her number of highly public affairs in the early 1970s and how her experience fed into the record's most famous song, You're So Vain, performing the missing fourth verse on the piano - the first time she has ever sung it along with the melody

programme.title: Duran Duran: A Night In
programme.desc: Simon Le Bon, Nick Rhodes, John Taylor and Roger Taylor sit back to watch and talk through personally selected clips of archive television, music shows, movies, performances, adverts and children's shows that have inspired them across their career. The band discuss their influences from the worlds of film and art, referencing Blade Runner, Andy Warhol and Tomorrow's World, and ranging from Barbarella to Virginia Plain and Midnight Express

programme.title: Bruce Dickinson: Scream for Me Sarajevo (2017)
programme.desc: Documentary about a 1994 concert by Bruce Dickinson and his band Skunkworks in Sarajevo, when the capital of Bosnia and Herzegovina was in its third year under siege during the ongoing Bosnian War. Featuring personal accounts of the band members who risked their lives to perform in a war zone, and the fans who attended the concert while living in the midst of continual violence

programme.title: Classic Albums
programme.desc: Carly Simon talks about her 1972 album No Secrets, reflecting on her time with ex-husband James Taylor, a heroin addict when they first met. She also recounts her number of highly public affairs in the early 1970s and how her experience fed into the record's most famous song, You're So Vain, performing the missing fourth verse on the piano - the first time she has ever sung it along with the melody

programme.title: Duran Duran: A Night In
programme.desc: Simon Le Bon, Nick Rhodes, John Taylor and Roger Taylor sit back to watch and talk through personally selected clips of archive television, music shows, movies, performances, adverts and children's shows that have inspired them across their career. The band discuss their influences from the worlds of film and art, referencing Blade Runner, Andy Warhol and Tomorrow's World, and ranging from Barbarella to Virginia Plain and Midnight Express

programme.title: Today at the Test
programme.desc: England v Australia. Action from the third day of the one-off Women's Ashes Test, held at Trent Bridge in Nottingham. When the teams faced each other on English soil in the 2019 series no play was possible until after lunch on the second day owing to bad weather, and the match ended in a draw. The Aussies would go on to win the series after dominating the limited overs matches and they have since retained the urn on home soil in 2021-22

programme.title: Glastonbury
programme.desc: Jamz Supernova introduces Jacob Collier's set from the West Holts Stage. The Grammy award-winning multi-instrumentalist has many famous fans, including Quincy Jones, Herbie Hancock and Chris Martin to name but a few. Expect harmonies, gadgets and a large ensemble of instruments for an unforgettable debut

programme.title: Glastonbury
programme.desc: Huw Stephens is at the helm for tonight's double bill as two music worlds unfurl side by side. First up from the Other Stage is Manic Street Preachers, whose debut album was released back in 1992. Fourteen albums later the Welsh rockers perform for the sixth time at Glastonbury, bringing their back catalogue of hits. Moving from rock to dance, Leftfield unleash their best moves from the Park Stage, bringing an electric energy 23 years since their last performance

programme.title: Glastonbury
programme.desc: The acclaimed musician, DJ and producer, who first appeared at the festival in 1986 with the Housemartins, headlines the Park Stage for the first time

programme.title: The Big Think
programme.desc: Dr Kevin Fong, who has a diverse background in astrophysics, aeronautics and medicine, offers a guide through the ethical, technical and scientific challenges of attempting to send astronauts to Mars. Costing billions of dollars, and the lives of those brave enough to attempt it, Kevin asks if the possible benefits are really worth the risk?

programme.title: Hancock's Half Hour
programme.desc: Driven to desperation by his sixth cold of the winter, Hancock tries various cures including a visit to a local witch and a keep-fit course

programme.title: Whatever Happened to the Likely Lads?
programme.desc: The ever-optimistic Bob tries to broaden Terry's social circle by inviting him to a trendy dinner party, but as usual his well-meaning efforts result in disaster. Rodney Bewes and James Bolam star as the original men behaving badly

programme.title: Imagine
programme.desc: Alan Yentob joins the South African artist William Kentridge as he prepares an epic frieze along the banks of the river Tiber in Rome. The presenter visits him in his hometown of Johannesburg, the inspiration for the magical hand-drawn animated films he calls Drawings for Projection. Brought up under Apartheid, Kentridge has witnessed the fragile transition to a multi-racial democracy and his art continues to reflect South Africa's turbulent times

programme.title: Glastonbury
programme.desc: Huw Stephens takes the helm for tonight's double bill with country act the Chicks, who make their debut at Glastonbury this evening. Having formed in 1989 in Dallas, performing bluegrass and country standards, they've evolved over the years, developing their sound to become more contemporary with politically charged lyrics, leading the way as country music's new generation. From The Other Stage, Dermot Kennedy marks his second return to the festival bringing hits from across two number one albums

programme.title: Glastonbury
programme.desc: Jamz Supernova introduces an hour of reggae and soul from the West Holts Stage. First up, Jamaica's '80s dancehall/reggae star Barrington Levy brings his distinctive voice to the fields of Worthy Farm and a back catalogue of '80s hits. That's followed by Candi Staton, whose hits include 'You Got the Love' and 'Young Hearts Run Free'

programme.title: Glastonbury
programme.desc: For the closing hours of this year's festival, Huw Stephens presents Glastonbury's rock and roll finale from the Other Stage. First up and originally from the east coast of America, with a synth and guitar approach to rock and roll, The War on Drugs present their hypnotic neo-psychedelic live experience. Queens of the Stone Age, who last performed at Glastonbury in 2011, close the evening with songs from their eighth studio album, 'In Times New Roman‚Ä¶'

programme.title: We Love Glastonbury
programme.desc: Famous fans recall their favourite performances and stand-out moments from the festival over the years. Noel Gallagher, Self Esteem, Jessie Ware, Nish Kumar, Kerry Godliman, Joe Wicks and more reflect on seeing the likes of Pet Shop Boys, Beyonc√©, Janelle Mon√°e, Foo Fighters, Miley Cyrus and the Killers at the festival

programme.title: Whoever Heard of a Black Artist? Britain's Hidden Art History
programme.desc: Brenda Emmanus follows Sonia Boyce as she prepares an exhibition at Manchester Art Gallery highlighting black and Asian artists who helped shape the history of British art. Featuring interviews with ground-breaking artists from the Windrush generation, 1960s counterculture revolutionaries and members of the Black Art Movement of the 1980s, with contributors including Rasheed Araeen, Lubaina Himid, Yinka Shonibare and Althea McNish

programme.title: Africa Turns the Page: The Novels That Shaped a Continent
programme.desc: Nigerian-born presenter and historian David Olusoga explores the story of the African novel, and a time when writers including Chinua Achebe, Ngugi wa Thiong'o and Wole Soyinka became the conscience of a continent. In their wake, the African novel was to spread around the world - writers of the African diaspora such as Buchi Emecheta and Ben Okri created masterpieces from their adopted home of the United Kingdom. Featuring contributions by Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie, Aminatta Forna and 2019 Booker winner Bernardine Evaristo

programme.title: My Life
programme.desc: Youth activist Anita takes us on a journey to show the impact fast fashion has on our world. She is determined that fashion can be sustainable. Our 'buy and throw away' culture contributes to the global warming crisis so something has to be done. In a vivid animated world, we learn about the journey that many of our clothes make; from where they are manufactured, all the way to how they are transported to the UK high streets - but are there other alternatives when buying our clothes? Anita sets out to explore sustainable solutions for young people. She talks to environmentalist Zaqiya about her school initiative, Swop it Up, and Holly, manager of the UK's largest charity shop. Together they show us ways young people can buy fashionable clothes and look after the planet at the same time.

Disa makes a milk mixture, sweetened with honey, and mixes it into flour to make a dough. She then grinds her special ingredient of cardamom into a powder and adds some into the dough and the rest of it into brown sugar. The dough is flattened, the brown sugar and cardamom mix is spread onto the dough and folded in. The dough is then cut into strips and twisted and wrapped into a bun ready to be baked. Will her friends like the cardamom when it's baked in her kardemummabullar?

programme.desc: Denise Nurse visits the coastal county of Cornwall, helping a couple to turn their favourite holiday destination into their permanent home on a budget of ¬£475,000. programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Angus wants a garden that reminds him of his favourite holiday destination, Cyprus. Angus loves to barbeque and entertain friends so would like a generous Cypriot-inspired space in which to do that and is also keen to try to grow his own produce. This group of women, united by their passion for woolly creations, routinely sneak out under cover of darkness. programme.title: Wynne's Welsh 70s
programme.desc: Alongside his dog Ginny, the celebrated tenor and broadcaster mines BBC Wales's archives of 1977 to present some of that year's TV gold. Welsh cooking also comes under the spotlight, the One Man and His Dog finals are relived, while there's a singles club in Swansea that is born from the loneliness of divorce

Georgiana is excited to anticipate her face on the new Australian $5 notes, but when Zoe realises she approved the wrong - and unflattering - portrait, the staff goes into damage control. Hoping to alleviate her constant and ruthless coverage on Steele News, Georgie invites CEO Richard Steele to dinner with the plan to charm him. Matthew suggests she tell Steele she shares his love of hunting, but this plan quickly backfires. Comedy, starring Catherine Tate

programme.title: Glastonbury
programme.desc: The Sheffield band perform on the Pyramid stage, their third time headlining the festival and a decade on from their last appearance. Following a huge sold-out world tour and armed with their recent seventh studio album The Car, they are likely to be one of the talking points of this year's event. Songs likely to be performed include Brianstorm, Fluorescent Adolescent, R U Mine? and I Bet That You Look Good on the Dancefloor. Introduced by Jo Whiley and Clara Amfo

programme.title: The Miseducation of Cameron Post (2018)
programme.desc: After teenager Cameron is caught in the backseat of a car with the prom queen, she is sent away to a treatment centre in a remote area called God's Promise. While being subjected to questionable gay conversion therapies, she bonds with fellow residents as they pretend to go along with the process while waiting to be released. Drama, starring Chloe Grace Moretz and John Gallagher Jr

programme.desc: When a mural by world famous street artist Banksy appeared overnight in the Neath town of Port Talbot it caused a sensation. Despite a local campaign, the artwork known as Season's Greetings was finally sold to an art dealer and removed. However, the legacy of Banksy is now to be seen everywhere across the steel community with an explosion of street art and over 40 new murals. On the site of the original Banksy, a new mural has appeared drawing attention to air pollution in an ironic homage to the Banksy original

programme.desc: The final episode explores the challenges that ocean life must overcome, including baby elephant seals and humpback whales endangered as their mothers end up surrounded by males vying for supremacy. programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce hosts from Woodhorn Museum in Northumberland. Treasures brought in to be valued include a gold Rolex 'President' wristwatch from the 1980s and a grotesque ceramic animal sculpture made by the eccentric Martin Brothers. Suzanne Zack is enchanted by a beautifully rendered pencil portrait by British artist Henry Ryland, while John Foster falls for a small Roman figure uncovered by a metal detectorist. Plus, Fiona learns tells the story of coal mining and the miners' way of life in the north-east of England

programme.title: Glastonbury
programme.desc: Clara Amfo, Lauren Laverne, Jack Saunders and Jo Whiley present the historic final performance of this year's festival, as Elton John makes his Glastonbury debut with a set that also marks the last show of his final UK tour. With a career of hits spanning over five decades, it's guaranteed to be a spectacular and emotional swan song to one of the world's greatest showmen

programme.title: Tulip Fever (2017)
programme.desc: In 17th-century Amsterdam at the height of tulip mania, an artist falls in love with a married woman whose portrait he has been commissioned to paint. Historical romance based on Deborah Moggach's novel, starring Alicia Vikander, Dane DeHaan and Jack O'Connell

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Sara Cox and Kimberley Walsh host the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: Naga Munchetty revisits more shocking stories from the archive, including the men who made millions by deliberately causing car accidents, endangering innocent lives. Plus, how the so-called victim who claimed an accident had left him terrified of heights blew his claim out of the water when he posted pictures of himself at the top of Europe's highest water slide

programme.title: Dirty Rotten Scammers
programme.desc: A woman who clicked a link she thought was from her phone company, which led to her losing out on big money. Presented by Mavis and Michelle Ackerley

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Dion Dublin, Martel Maxwell and Tommy Walsh follow an impressive project to create four brand new houses in Alcester in Warwickshire. They also report on efforts to transform terraced houses in Little Hulton in Greater Manchester and Norwich

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Caroline Hawley presents the contest from Hemswell in Lincolnshire. Experts Izzie Balmer and Mark Stacey help guide the Red and Blue teams to a prime purchase in a bid to make the greater profit at auction. Caroline also pays a visit to the Lincoln Castle Victorian Prison

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: When a troubled soul from the past returns, the priest must investigate the new chapter of the Church of Apollo. Crime drama based on the GK Chesterton stories, with Mark Williams

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jay Blades is at Altrincham Recycling Centre on a mission to rescue and revive unwanted items. With two eclectic skip-finds to transform, he turns to designer Sarah Peterson to update a side table and chest of drawers. Jay takes on four dining chairs as his own creative project. Narrated by Arthur Smith

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Denise Nurse visits the coastal county of Cornwall, helping a couple to turn their favourite holiday destination into their permanent home on a budget of ¬£475,000. Away from the search, she visits a new development that's tackling the county's housing crisis by prioritising the needs of local Cornish people

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Angus wants a garden that reminds him of his favourite holiday destination, Cyprus. Currently he hates his awkward shaped plot and absolutely loathes the domineering dark grey retaining wall, which he thinks makes the space look like a prison yard. Angus loves to barbeque and entertain friends so would like a generous Cypriot-inspired space in which to do that and is also keen to try to grow his own produce. Lee Burkhill and Flo Headlam head to Southampton to address his needs on a budget of ¬£6,000

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: The team heads to south London to help a mum-of-two with her overflowing kitchen and ever-growing shoe collection. In just 24 hours, on a limited budget, the team adds clever storage to the kitchen and turns her spare room into a relaxing sanctuary with new shelving for her shoe display

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong hosts the quiz in which contestants try to record the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Lauren Laverne reveals the correct answers and comments on the players' scores

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Gethin Jones round off the working week with a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: Our Lives
programme.desc: Creations of the Swansea Yarnbombers adorn postboxes across the Welsh city. This group of women, united by their passion for woolly creations, routinely sneak out under cover of darkness. Their work might appear on a park bench or decorate a tree, but this warm-hearted documentary follows them as they face their biggest challenge - decorating Mumbles pier

programme.title: Landward
programme.desc: In a weather-focused special, Dougie Vipond heads out into the North Sea to visit Scotland's biggest offshore wind farm as it nears completion, while Anne Lundon explores how the installation's impact on marine mammals is being monitored. Chris Blanchett finds out how a favourite summer treat is produced using the power of the sun in the north-east of Scotland

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: In the first half of a two-part special where the same teams do battle across two episodes, the guests are former Wales cross-code rugby star Scott Quinnell, ex-England goalkeeper Rachel Brown-Finnis, Great Britain sprinter Harry Aikines-Aryeetey and world champion swimmer Karen Pickering. With team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: When Lee and Lucy are asked to cover for Anna on more than one occasion so she can go out at night for secret Italian lessons, they suspect the worst - that she is having an affair. Lee decides it is up to him to tell Toby that his marriage is in jeopardy and sets about finding the evidence. Comedy, starring Lee Mack, Sally Bretton, Abigail Cruttenden and Hugh Dennis

programme.title: Queen of Oz
programme.desc: When word gets out that Georgie has been sleeping with one of her staff, she fixes the problem by firing her 'boytoy' Augustus. Georgiana is excited to anticipate her face on the new Australian $5 notes, but when Zoe realises she approved the wrong - and unflattering - portrait, the staff goes into damage control. Hoping to alleviate her constant and ruthless coverage on Steele News, Georgie invites CEO Richard Steele to dinner with the plan to charm him. Matthew suggests she tell Steele she shares his love of hunting, but this plan quickly backfires. Comedy, starring Catherine Tate

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Glastonbury
programme.desc: The Sheffield band perform on the Pyramid stage, their third time headlining the festival and a decade on from their last appearance. Following a huge sold-out world tour and armed with their recent seventh studio album The Car, they are likely to be one of the talking points of this year's event. Songs likely to be performed include Brianstorm, Fluorescent Adolescent, R U Mine? and I Bet That You Look Good on the Dancefloor. Introduced by Jo Whiley and Clara Amfo

programme.title: The Miseducation of Cameron Post (2018)
programme.desc: After teenager Cameron is caught in the backseat of a car with the prom queen, she is sent away to a treatment centre in a remote area called God's Promise. While being subjected to questionable gay conversion therapies, she bonds with fellow residents as they pretend to go along with the process while waiting to be released. Drama, starring Chloe Grace Moretz and John Gallagher Jr

programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt is joined by chefs Ching-He Huang and Mike Reid, plus special guest Danny Jones. Helen McGinn picks the wines to go with the studio dishes

programme.title: Nadiya Bakes
programme.desc: Nadiya Hussain shares her love of baking with some of her favourite recipes, from every day treats to indulgent desserts. In the second episode, Nadiya shares recipes for her most indulgent desserts, from frozen blueberry and banana cheesecake to husband's favourite jam roly poly. Later, Nadiya also shares her tips and tricks for her picture perfect tutti frutti pavlova

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Properties in Sevenoaks in Kent, Beeston in Nottinghamshire and Dalston in east London are sold at auction. Presenters including Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell report on progress as these varied projects encounter unexpected twists and turns

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Tennis: Queen's
programme.desc: The cinch Championships. Clare Balding presents coverage of day six of the men's grass-court tournament at Queen's Club, featuring the singles semi-finals. Both matches at the corresponding stage of last year's tournament were settled in straight sets, with Filip Krajinovic beating Marin Cilic 6-3 6-3, and Matteo Berrettini recording a 6-4 6-3 victory over Botic van de Zandschulp

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: The Hit List
programme.desc: Marvin and Rochelle Humes present a celebrity edition of the music-based quiz show, featuring DJ Chris Moyles and actor James Buckley, Radio 1 DJs Rickie Haywood-Williams and Charlie Hedges, and sports star Sam Quek and presenter Martel Maxwell. The three teams must name as many hit songs and artists as possible under intense pressure, with a ¬£10,000 jackpot for charity up for grabs

programme.title: Michael McIntyre's The Wheel
programme.desc: The comedian hosts the Saturday-night gameshow, in which contestants take on a colossal spinning wheel and answer questions in the hope of securing a cash prize. Tonight's expert celebrity advice comes from Dermot O'Leary on fish, Nicola Adams on boxing, Alexander Armstrong on classical music, Denise Van Outen on the 1990s, Olly Smith on wine, Gloria Hunniford on Hollywood icons, and Rhys Stephenson on children's TV

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman present a star-studded version of the general knowledge quiz. Rick Edwards, Emer Kenny, Danny Wallace, Yuriko Kotani, Ian Waite, Vincent Simone, Russ Bray and Deta Hedman try to come up with the least likely correct answers to a series of questions posed to members of the public

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Faith hurriedly tries to hide her pills when she is interrupted by Luka and his friend Johnny - who later has a fit. She rushes the boy to ED, assuming he has taken the pills, and is quick to admit the possibility of an overdose. However, there may be other medical issues she is not aware of, with potentially disastrous consequences. Rida investigates a mystery, Jacob starts to doubt his relationship, and Sah receives news about their surgery

programme.title: Glastonbury
programme.desc: Clara Amfo introduces two of the biggest pop artists on the planet performing on the Pyramid Stage. First up is Lewis Capaldi, who performed last month at Radio 1 Big Weekend in Dundee, and recently scored his second number one album Broken By Desire to Be Heavenly Sent. Following Capaldi on the Pyramid Stage is Grammy award-winning US pop star Lizzo, who returns to Worthy Farm after her triumphant 2019 set

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Misbehaviour (2020)
programme.desc: It's 1970, and Bob Hope is due to host the Miss World beauty pageant in London, one of the most watched shows in the world. However, the organisers, and the Hollywood star, do not count on the newly formed women's liberation movement, who plan to disrupt the controversial ceremony. Director Philippa Lowthorpe's comedy drama, starring Keira Knightley, Gugu Mbatha-Raw and Jessie Buckley

programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Tennis: Queen's
programme.desc: The cinch Championships. Coverage of the men's singles final in the grass-court tournament at Queen's Club. Italy's Matteo Berrettini prevailed 7-5, 6-4 over Filip Krajinovic of Serbia in last year's showpiece match to lift this trophy for the second year running. The feat put him in good company, with former world number ones Lleyton Hewitt, Andy Roddick and Andy Murray the other players to have won this title two or more times in a row this century

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and Harry and David Rich transform a garden in Bournemouth for young married couple Thomas and Rhiann. They have a budget of ¬£3,000 to create a shady, flower-filled space in their sunny back garden and Tom has a lifelong dream of putting in a massive koi carp pond

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Glastonbury
programme.desc: Lauren Laverne presents two more of today's performances from the Pyramid Stage. Rick Astley makes his Glastonbury debut with a mass singalong of 1980s hits, while New York punk pop legends Blondie will be taking to the stage with classic numbers from their five decade long career

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Adam Henson celebrates the 50th anniversary of the Rare Breed Survival Trust, a charity founded by his father to reverse the decline of rare breed numbers in the UK. With summer temperatures rising, Adam welcomes a shearing gang on site to remove the coats of his commercial sheep, and is visited by the Chief Executive of the British Pig Association. Plus, a Gloucester Bull is prepared for a day at a country show

programme.title: Spy in the Ocean
programme.desc: The final episode explores the challenges that ocean life must overcome, including baby elephant seals and humpback whales endangered as their mothers end up surrounded by males vying for supremacy. A lone sealion chases tuna, one of the fastest fish in the ocean. Not only must it find a way of catching this enormous fish, but it must do so whilst fighting off hungry sharks

programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Gethin Jones round off the working week with a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: Feed Yourself Fitter with Stephen Nolan
programme.desc: Stephen visits student nurse Jennifer in East Belfast. Studying hard for her finals while working long hours in Craigavon Intensive Care Unit, she has little time to look after herself. Mindlessly eating junk to keep her energy levels up, Jennifer is feeling guilty and hypocritical that as a nurse she is giving out advice to patients about their health and diet that she obviously does not follow herself. Her father's dying wish was for his daughter to be the best nurse she could be, so she turns to chef Paula McIntyre hoping her tips will help her cut out binge snacking, which she thinks is holding her back from excelling at her chosen profession

programme.title: Restoration Rescue
programme.desc: Patrick Bradley transforms a derelict cottage and barn on his family farm in Maghera. With no one having lived there for over 100 years and only being used as storage and shelter for animals since, he plans to make the buildings family spaces again. With so much family history tied up in the fabric of the buildings, Patrick feels the pressure to get the restoration right for the generations before him and those to come

programme.title: A Wright Family Holiday
programme.desc: Mark Wright, his brother Josh and father Mark Sr head to Northumberland. Mark Sr regales his sons with facts about Hadrian's Wall, local castles and the origins of Earl Grey tea. The history buff is in charge of choosing the night's accommodation and picks rooms in 800-year-old Chillingham castle - which Mark Jr is horrified to discover is reputed to be the most haunted castle in Britain. The next morning the trio partake in a little coasteering, which involves climbing up and down the rocky shoreline and jumping off cliffs into the North Sea. The visit ends with a relaxing trip to a spa

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: When Lee and Lucy are asked to cover for Anna on more than one occasion so she can go out at night for secret Italian lessons, they suspect the worst - that she is having an affair. programme.desc: The cinch Championships. Coverage of the men's singles final in the grass-court tournament at Queen's Club. Italy's Matteo Berrettini prevailed 7-5, 6-4 over Filip Krajinovic of Serbia in last year's showpiece match to lift this trophy for the second year running. The feat put him in good company, with former world number ones Lleyton Hewitt, Andy Roddick and Andy Murray the other players to have won this title two or more times in a row this century

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and Harry and David Rich transform a garden in Bournemouth for young married couple Thomas and Rhiann. They have a budget of ¬£3,000 to create a shady, flower-filled space in their sunny back garden and Tom has a lifelong dream of putting in a massive koi carp pond

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Glastonbury
programme.desc: Lauren Laverne presents two more of today's performances from the Pyramid Stage. Rick Astley makes his Glastonbury debut with a mass singalong of 1980s hits, while New York punk pop legends Blondie will be taking to the stage with classic numbers from their five decade long career

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Adam Henson celebrates the 50th anniversary of the Rare Breed Survival Trust, a charity founded by his father to reverse the decline of rare breed numbers in the UK. With summer temperatures rising, Adam welcomes a shearing gang on site to remove the coats of his commercial sheep, and is visited by the Chief Executive of the British Pig Association. Plus, a Gloucester Bull is prepared for a day at a country show

programme.title: Spy in the Ocean
programme.desc: The final episode explores the challenges that ocean life must overcome, including baby elephant seals and humpback whales endangered as their mothers end up surrounded by males vying for supremacy. A lone sealion chases tuna, one of the fastest fish in the ocean. Not only must it find a way of catching this enormous fish, but it must do so whilst fighting off hungry sharks

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce hosts from Woodhorn Museum in Northumberland. Treasures brought in to be valued include a gold Rolex 'President' wristwatch from the 1980s and a grotesque ceramic animal sculpture made by the eccentric Martin Brothers. Suzanne Zack is enchanted by a beautifully rendered pencil portrait by British artist Henry Ryland, while John Foster falls for a small Roman figure uncovered by a metal detectorist. Plus, Fiona learns tells the story of coal mining and the miners' way of life in the north-east of England

programme.title: Glastonbury
programme.desc: Clara Amfo, Lauren Laverne, Jack Saunders and Jo Whiley present the historic final performance of this year's festival, as Elton John makes his Glastonbury debut with a set that also marks the last show of his final UK tour. With a career of hits spanning over five decades, it's guaranteed to be a spectacular and emotional swan song to one of the world's greatest showmen

programme.title: Tulip Fever (2017)
programme.desc: In 17th-century Amsterdam at the height of tulip mania, an artist falls in love with a married woman whose portrait he has been commissioned to paint. Historical romance based on Deborah Moggach's novel, starring Alicia Vikander, Dane DeHaan and Jack O'Connell
