With analysis from Jason Weaver and Megan Nicholls, reports by Rishi Persad, Matt Chapman, Luke Harvey, Oli Bell and Adele Mulrennan, commentary from Richard Hoiles and Mark Johnson, lifestyle with Mark Heyes and Charlotte Hawkins, and Social Stable with Chris Hughes

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: ITV News London
programme.desc: Headlines affecting the local area

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern heads to Portsmouth for the game show in which he travels around the UK setting members of the public unusual challenges, giving them the chance to win anything from the price of their petrol to ¬£1,000 in the final game.

programme.title: Celebrity Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts as contestants Katie Piper, Kiell Smith-Bynoe and Shaun Williamson 'see it and say it' as they try to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. After the first elimination, the two remaining players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win ¬£50,000 for the charity of their choice

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh hosts an I'm a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here special as former participants AJ Pritchard, Hollie Arnold, Giovanna Fletcher and Russell Watson pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: The 1% Club
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Lee Mack in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred contestants begin every show, but who will make it to the end and answer a question only one per cent of the country can get right - and win up to ¬£100,000?

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Pitch Perfect (2012)
programme.desc: Under heavy pressure from her father, Beca reluctantly starts her first year at Barden University and gets an internship at the school radio station. She soon acquires a new circle of friends in the form of a band of misfits with a shared talent for singing, joining their a cappella group and trying to inject some much needed energy into their repertoire. Comedy, starring Anna Kendrick, Brittany Snow, Anna Camp, Rebel Wilson and Skylar Astin

programme.title: Bradley & Barney Walsh: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: The duo continue to explore Costa Rica. Inspired by childhood memories, the pair head to the country's cloud forest, where they attempt tree climbing. They also visit a local sanctuary that is home to 2000 free roaming dogs, before heading into the countryside to meet a former Olympian in Kayak Slalom, where the father and son go head-to-head in a time trial

programme.title: Shop: Ideal World
programme.desc: A selection of Ideal World repeat shows

programme.title: Ainsley's Food We Love
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott prepares meals for a lazy Sunday, joined by Gyles Brandreth, Henry Firth, Ian Theasby and Candice Brown. On the menu are sweetcorn fritters served with avocado, tomato and black bean salsa and poached eggs, custard tarts, bloody Mary with polenta mozzarella sticks, and rosemary and anchovy slow roasted lamb with roasted roots, while Gyles contributes his take on the fish finger sandwich

programme.title: Unwind with ITV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Fishing Allstars
programme.desc: Dean Macey and Adam Rooney travel across Italy, with their main target a monster wels catfish of up to 300lbs in the River Po. They also aim to catch smaller channel catfish from the River Arno and carp from a stunning mountain lake near Bologna

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Game show that sees teenage presenter Danny Murphy take on some of the craziest dares, from rock climbing to racing a hovercraft! In this episode, Danny takes to the water on a surf simulator as he attempts a 360 degree spin!

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. When Lloyd finds a discarded leg behind the washing machine, he is mistakenly declared a hero for defeating a bloodthirsty spider. Unable to resist the praise and free comics, Lloyd goes along with it... but he's then confronted by an actual spider.

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Lloyd finds an entire sweetie, but when he is unable to move it on his own, he reluctantly leaves it in the care of a passing wasp while he gets Abacus and PB. When the wasp steals the sweetie and takes it to their nest, Lloyd then gathers a team to stage a sweet-retrieving heist!

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: The heroes of International Rescue must deal with emergencies on two fronts when an orbiting solar energy station malfunctions, placing a passing airliner - and its precious cargo - in peril

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: The Spuds take the camper van on holiday, and end up at the bottom of the sea. Dave has to resort to a resourceful solution to get help.

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Dave rescues an endangered donkey from the docks. Hiding it in the camper van, things take a turn when the donkey eats Gran's glasses.

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Brick decides to launch the quest for the golden sock! It's a treasure hunt in the forest. The hunt is mapped out through riddles based on school lessons from that year. The first one to find the sock gets to choose where the next field trip will be! Since he hasn't studied, Mo decides to ask for the power to know everything the Internet knows. But with the half power, the scepter materialises the Internet under the form of a little boy and a little girl...

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. City Hall set up a day for kids to pick up litter in the city. Noomi sees this as her chance to spend a romantic day with Mo. But Mo has one thing only on his mind: the top level in his video game! All he has to do is cross the bridge, fight the last duel and he'll win! But it's hopeless: every time, Mo botches this ultimate challenge. He requests the Scepter to grant him the power to enter his video game and cross the bridge for real!

programme.title: Scooby-Doo and Guess Who?
programme.desc: Jump into the Mystery Machine for more comedic mystery-solving adventures with Scooby and the gang. Legendary game show host Alex Trebek hosts an episode of the quiz show Jeopardy! featuring Velma and Shaggy competing against a robot called Max Kilobyte, who goes on a rampage against anyone that looks like they might cause him to lose the game.

programme.desc: The return of the show featuring celebrity guests, advice from experts and tips for entertainment in the week ahead, with Lee Mead and Ekin-Su Culculoglu joining Katie

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Joining Alan at Manor Farm are comedian Omid Djalili, discussing the good things in life, and political journalist Robert Peston. Plus, Alan tries his hand at competitive carriage driving and there is the best in honey-based cocktails

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and the team are in Hemel Hempstead, Hertfordshire, where they meet deaf couple Asif Iqbal and wife Sabina. programme.title: Rio 2 (2014)
programme.desc: Parrots Jewel and Blu lead a happy life together in Rio with their three chicks, until they find themselves hurled into an expedition up the Amazon. The journey leads to an encounter with an old enemy, while Blu also has to win the approval of Jewel's fearsome father. Animated comedy sequel, with the voices of Jesse Eisenberg, Anne Hathaway and Jamie Foxx

programme.title: The Man with the Golden Gun (1974)
programme.desc: James Bond's investigation into the death of a world-renowned scientist working on solar technology draws him into a battle of wits with a stealthy assassin, who dispatches his victims with a golden bullet and has the British secret agent next in his sights. Spy adventure, starring Roger Moore, Christopher Lee, Britt Ekland and Maud Adams

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Chizzy Akudolu, Andrew Pierce, Sonja McLaughlan and Jack Carroll pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. programme.title: Sitting on a Fortune

Players position themselves in a row of seats one behind another, with one wrong answer seeing them relegated to the back of the line and in real danger of leaving with nothing

programme.title: Van Der Valk
programme.desc: Ric van der Molden, the arrogant rising young star of the Amsterdam museum scene, is murdered with an ancient Indonesian ceremonial sword . The detective and the team think they are looking at a crime rooted in the world of colonial artefacts and the thorny issue of restitution, but the victim turns out to have a strong link with a notorious historical murder case

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The Clinic
programme.desc: Documentary telling the story of the rise and fall of the Tavistock Centre's Gender Identity Development Service (GIDS), now one of the most controversial units in the NHS. Through the powerful testimony of insiders and patients, this film from the Exposure strand provides a vivid insight into what led to its closure amid a continuing and highly charged debate around gender identity in the UK

programme.title: DNA Journey
programme.desc: Comedians Joel Dommett and Tom Allen are delving into their respective family histories as they embark on a road-trip around the UK. Joel learns of an ancestor who produced inventions that saved thousands of lives, and Tom discovers the emotional story of his great grandparents

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. PB sets Lloyd up in a fight with Dotty the ladybird's brother Freckles - worried that he'll defeat a little ladybird with ease, Lloyd makes himself as weak and unfit as possible to make the fight fairer, but Freckles is not the weak opponent he expected...

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: The Tracy brothers and their friends at International Rescue set out to foil the nefarious plots of the evil Hood. programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The amateur sleuths uncover the remains of a racehorse while engaged on horticultural work in the grounds of pop star Nev Connolly's supposedly haunted mansion. Before long, gruesome revelations are coming thick and fast as Nev is shot dead and more bones are discovered - this time belonging to a young woman. As they investigate further, Rosemary and Laura are plunged into a sinister mystery with roots deep in the past. Drama, guest starring Murray Head (Heartbeat) and Abigail Cruttenden (Benidorm)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: A cleaner is found dead in her home and suspicion immediately falls upon her lodger, who is arrested and convicted of her murder. It appears to be an open-and-shut case, but Superintendent Spence begins to question the man's guilt and invites Poirot to help uncover the identity of the real killer. The Belgian sleuth teams up with crime writer Ariadne Oliver (My Family's Zoe Wanamaker) as he tries to crack the case. Whodunit, starring David Suchet, with Richard Hope, Joe Absolom, Amanda Root, Sian Phillips and Raquel Cassidy

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: Schoolgirl Jennifer Sutcliffe becomes embroiled in a mystery when priceless jewels are hidden among her belongings. The precious stones once belonged to a prince who fell foul of a revolution, and now his cousin is a pupil at the same school as Jennifer, where Poirot finds himself drawn into the unlikely situation and realises nothing is quite what it seems. David Suchet stars as the Belgian sleuth, with Harriet Walter and Claire Skinner

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The detective's friend Sir Charles Cartwright (guest star Martin Shaw) hosts a cocktail party at his home in Cornwall, where an amiable local priest chokes to death on his drink. There seems to be no motive for murder, and no trace of poison found in the victim's glass, but weeks later, when Sir Charles's doctor friend Sir Bartholomew Strange dies in similar circumstances, he and Poirot team up to investigate. Drama, with Art Malik, Jane Asher and Anna Carteret, and David Suchet in the title role

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The body of farmer Alex Preston is found in the middle of the sacred Crowcall stone circle in Midsomer Mow, with new medical examiner Dr Kate Wilding confirming that the victim was disembowelled but that a head injury was the likely cause of death. Suspicion initially falls on local druids led by high priests Ezra Canning and Leticia Clifford, since Preston's plans to plough Gorse Meadow would have barred their access to the site. Barnaby and Jones are joined by Wilding to investigate, and as the case wears on, the inspector becomes convinced greed rather than spiritualism is the motive. Starring Neil Dudgeon, Jason Hughes and Tamzin Malleson

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A tax inspector goes missing as he tries to track down the maker of an illicit, potent cider popular among the residents of Midsomer Abbas. Barnaby and Jones have a murder investigation on their hands when the man's body is found floating in a vat at the village's spring fair, where the duo are sampling the local brew. Pathologist Kate Wilding says the victim's injuries look as if he was shaken to death by a giant, and as their inquiries continue, they discover the area is steeped in bizarre local traditions. Guest starring Warren Clarke (Dalziel & Pascoe) and Denise Black (Coronation Street)

programme.title: The Suspicions of Mr Whicher
programme.desc: Feature-length period drama based on the book by Kate Summerscale. Inspector Jack Whicher is part of the newly formed Scotland Yard detective department and travels to Rode, Wiltshire, to investigate a murder at a country house. With no material evidence and only an inept local police force to help, he faces the unenviable task of solving a case in which members of the grieving family are the main suspects. Starring Paddy Considine, Peter Capaldi and Emma Fielding

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: With their friendship in tatters, the lack of communication between Rachel and Janet is making even the simplest of tasks difficult, and it takes a call about Gill's possible abduction to reunite them as a team. The duo soon have Gill's car in their sights and identify the kidnapper, but discover they are heading for a notorious suicide location. Can the detectives get to their boss in time?

programme.title: Unwind with ITV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Shopping from home.

programme.title: On the Buses
programme.desc: Blakey organises an exhibition as the bus company celebrates its half-centenary. Stan reminisces, and on falling asleep finds himself at the wheel of a bus from the turn of the 20th century. Comedy. starring Reg Varney and Stephen Lewis

programme.title: Inspector Morse
programme.desc: An opera singer is shot by a sniper at an Oxford University ceremony just as she is about to receive an honorary degree. Morse is a big fan of her work and thinks she could not possibly be involved in anything untoward, but his investigations turn up more than a few sordid secrets. Detective drama, starring John Thaw, Kevin Whately, Robert Hardy, Sheila Gish, John Gielgud and Rachel Weisz

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: A murder victim is found in unusual circumstances, buried with a cache of 100-year-old timber. A likely suspect is soon identified, only to be shot dead by a mystery assassin - a development that has repercussions for DI Lane's love life. Jack Shepherd stars as the dour Cornish copper, with Helen Masters

programme.title: Carry On Again Doctor (1969)
programme.desc: A disgraced surgeon sets up a clinic in the hope of promoting a supposedly miraculous slimming potion made from secret ingredients discovered on a remote tropical island. Comedy, starring Sid James, Kenneth Williams, Jim Dale, Barbara Windsor, Charles Hawtrey, Hattie Jacques, Pat Coombs and Joan Sims

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: Geraldine McEwan makes her last appearance as the spinster sleuth before handing over the knitting needles to Julia McKenzie. Following the death of old acquaintance Mr Rafiel, Miss Marple receives instructions drawn up prior to his demise asking her to embark on a coach tour to investigate an unspecified possible crime. It soon transpires that many of her companions are also travelling at his invitation and they are all in some way connected to a girl who went missing from a nun's sanctuary during World War Two, supposedly to be with her German lover, Rafiel's son Michael. Murder mystery, with a star-studded supporting cast including Richard E Grant, Johnny Briggs, Amanda Burton, Anne Reid, Ronni Ancona, George Cole, Will Mellor and Laura Michelle Kelly

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: When a business magnate, his wife and their maid are murdered, Miss Marple (Julia McKenzie) is prompted by the circumstances surrounding the incidents to recall the nursery rhyme Sing a Song of Sixpence. She discovers the victims were part of a family tainted by secrets, and as she ponders the significance of the tune, a past scandal reveals itself. Murder mystery, featuring Wendy Richard as feisty cook Mrs Crump, in her final dramatic role. Other guest stars include Prunella Scales, Matthew Macfadyen, Ralf Little, Rupert Graves and Helen Baxendale

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: Ever since a beautiful American woman arrived in the peaceful village of Wychwood-under-Ashe, people have begun to die in a series of apparent accidents. Nobody suspects a killer is at work but, as the body count rises, Miss Marple digs a little deeper with the help of a former policeman - and they gradually unearth a secret that will rock the village to its core. Murder mystery, starring Julia McKenzie, Benedict Cumberbatch, David Haig, Sylvia Syms, Margo Stilley and Hugo Speer

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: Laura and Rosemary are asked to restore an ornate water garden cascade in the grounds of a health spa, where they are invited to join owner Frances Caldecott and her children for dinner. That evening, the duo discover Frances has been strangled and her jewellery stolen, and set out to catch the culprit. Drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The duo are hired to cure a patchy lawn at a select language school hiding dark secrets. The disappearance of a Polish student alerts them to a tale of passion, rivalry and revenge, and when a handyman is found with his throat cut they race to find the killer. Drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris

programme.title: The Larkins
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh and Joanna Scanlan take over the roles of Pop and Ma Larkin from David Jason and Pam Ferris in a reboot of The Darling Buds of May. In the first edition, there is excitement at the approaching May Day Fair and new blood in the village. But daughter Mariette has bombshell news and the tax man comes calling, leaving the Larkins' future looking far from rosy. With Sabrina Bartlett and Tok Stephen

programme.title: The Savoy
programme.desc: Documentary offering a glimpse into the lives of those lucky enough to check into the glamorous London hotel, and those who serve them. Tonight, the hotel staff are on high alert for the imminent arrival of a mystery hotel inspector, and are anxious to find out if The Savoy will retain its Forbes five-star status

programme.title: Foyle's War
programme.desc: The detective's investigation into the death of a nameless Russian leads to a mysterious military facility run by Colonel Harry Galt, a respected soldier with an impeccable war record. However, as Foyle makes inquiries, he realises the deceased was a spy with dangerous connections to British Intelligence. Meanwhile, Sam does her best to help husband Adam during his by-election campaign, but can't help putting her foot in it. Crime drama, starring Michael Kitchen and Honeysuckle Weeks, with Jonathan Hyde and Daniel Weyman

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: Lady Southwold, Lady Marjorie's widowed mother, and her companion Miss Hodges arrive, throwing the household into turmoil. Later, the staff below stairs are dismayed to hear that a brooch has apparently been stolen

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: Elizabeth joins the suffragette movement and plans a raid on a local MP's house, but it is Rose who is arrested during the ensuing scuffle and sent to Holloway Prison

programme.title: On the Buses
programme.desc: Stan is offered a job in a car factory in the midlands and decides the best way to quit his job at the bus depot is by getting himself sacked in order to earn an extra week's wages. Reg Varney stars

programme.title: On the Buses
programme.desc: Jack and the inspector try to fix a water heater, but their efforts end in disaster. Comedy, starring Stephen Lewis and Bob Grant

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: Feature-length drama. While holidaying at the plush Bertram's Hotel in London, Miss Marple is presented with a fresh challenge to her deductive powers when the reading of a will leads to a double murder. Geraldine McEwan stars as the elderly spinster with a nose for a mystery, with guest appearances by Peter Davison, Mica Paris and Francesca Annis

programme.title: On the Buses
programme.desc: The inspector's mother comes to stay, and proves to be a thoroughly unpleasant person. Seventies comedy, starring Stephen Lewis and Bob Grant

programme.title: Made in Britain
programme.desc: A look at how the hovercraft inspired the invention of one of Britain's best-selling lawnmowers, and an insight into the making of a suitcase beloved by royalty, Arctic explorers and Hollywood celebrities. Plus, what it takes to craft a spoon fit for the Downing Street dinner table, and the bangers that turned the sausage status-quo on its head. Ricky Tomlinson narrates

programme.title: Magnum, PI
programme.desc: The president of a family-run business hires Thomas to investigate whether his nephew is secretly siphoning off company funds to line his own pocket. Detective drama, starring Tom Selleck

programme.title: The Sweeney
programme.desc: A routine surveillance assignment leads Regan and Carter to a massive car-parking fraud. Crackerjack veteran Peter Glaze features in the supporting cast, alongside John Thaw and Dennis Waterman

programme.title: Minder
programme.desc: Terry is assigned to mind a writer of romantic fiction with a drink problem, whose ex-husband has sold their house behind her back. Beryl Reid and Bill Maynard guest star, alongside George Cole and Dennis Waterman

programme.title: ITV Racing Live

With analysis from Jason Weaver, reports by Rishi Persad, Matt Chapman, Luke Harvey and Adele Mulrennan, and commentary by Mark Johnson

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: Jeremy Wade visits southern Africa to see if he can track down a deadly fish that lurks in the eerie waters of the Okavango. A killer with shark-like teeth, there are stories of it hunting in packs and feeding on schooling fish or even human bodies. Jeremy is determined to find out if it is a giant piranha or something equally terrifying

programme.title: BattleBots
programme.desc: The competition heats up as the teams start to feel the pressure, and undefeated Hypershock looks to take down the reigning champion Bite Force

programme.title: The Motorbike Show

programme.desc: Hard-hitting action from the world of All Elite Wrestling - the roster features world-class talent including Jon Moxley, Chris Jericho, Bryan Danielson and Claudio Castagnoli, and many more who bring a freshness and energy into professional wrestling

programme.title: Speed 2: Cruise Control (1997)
programme.desc: Feisty heroine Annie and her new boyfriend Alex take a cruise in the Bahamas, but the trip becomes a nightmare when they discover a vengeful computer genius - a former employee laid off because of his terminal illness - is also on board. He has secretly programmed the ship to crash into an oil tanker while he steals a cache of diamonds from the cargo. Action thriller sequel, with Sandra Bullock, Jason Patric and Willem Dafoe

Robbie Coltrane and Art Malik guest star, with George Cole and Patrick Malahide

programme.title: Minder

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The long-running animation reaches its 500th episode. Homer and his family are forced to leave town and live as outcasts after angering the people of Springfield one too many times. Helping them adjust to their new life is WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange, while the cartoon's theme is given a makeover by singer Alison Krauss

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Mr Burns gets rid of his power plant employees and replaces them all with robots - with the exception of Homer. programme.title: Edward VIII: Britain's Traitor King
programme.desc: Documentary exploring evidence that Edward VIII may have collaborated with the Nazis following his abdication in 1936, as well as the establishment cover-up of his loyalties that occurred following the war. Historians examine the possibility that the former king may have passed information to known spies and been complicit in a plot to reinstate him to the throne in the event of Britain being successfully occupied

programme.title: Princess Anne: The Plot to Kidnap a Royal
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the 1974 plot to kidnap Princess Anne, which led to an extraordinary shoot-out, unfolding on London's the Mall, in the shadow of Buckingham Palace, which left four men shot while trying to protect the princess. Key witnesses share their perspective on the ensuing mayhem and violence

programme.title: Britain's Great Cathedrals with Tony Robinson
programme.desc: The actor recounts the history of Winchester Cathedral, the longest medieval cathedral in northern Europe, which has witnessed civil wars, religious battles and struggled with collapsing foundations. It is the burial place of novelist Jane Austen - though only four people attended her funeral and originally her plaque made no mention of her writing. Tony learns that Winchester's bishops were among the richest, most influential and most badly behaved in the country and some were wealthier and more powerful than even England's kings

programme.title: The Year Britain Burned: Summer '22
programme.desc: A look back at the UK's hottest year on record, when three heatwaves in consecutive months meant the summer became a story of chaos as Britain's infrastructure went into meltdown. Devastating wildfires broke out in grasslands, farmland and gardens, while an official drought was declared after the driest July in 85 years and the heat ravaged large areas of the country. Featuring contributions from Clare Nasir, Simon Calder, Vanessa Feltz and Adam Henson

programme.title: Jeremy Clarkson's Most Shocking Moments
programme.desc: For 30 years Jeremy Clarkson has been one of the most controversial people in Britain, having made a career out of being outrageous and saying the unthinkable. But following recent shocking comments he made in the Sun newspaper about the Duchess of Sussex, has he finally gone too far? This programme has the inside stories of controversies surrounding the TV presenter, including a diplomatic incident in Argentina, insulting a prime minister, punching Piers Morgan and attacking Top Gear's producer

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Officers swoop on a housing estate searching for suspects involved in a shooting and it needs to be a tightly controlled operation and communication is key between the firearms unit, police helicopters and dog handler Duncan. Elsewhere, Steve responds to reports of a burglary in progress, and ends up on a chase through back gardens. After catching one of the suspects, Steve receives a shock when he returns to check out the burgled house

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Steve is involved in a dangerous high-speed pursuit of a car stolen in a burglary. The fleeing driver ditches and runs, but will the police chopper be able to keep him in their sights? Claire and Tom deal with an abusive drunk driver who is clueless about what he has done wrong, rookie Omar tackles a fence-hopping suspect whose antics have left him with a slashed hand, and Steve tracks down a car suspected of being involved in a robbery

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Dog handler Duncan attends a midnight stand-off between armed officers and a man who has been seen carrying knives, Suggs pulls over a motorist who appears incapable of telling the truth, and Charlie is given the unenviable task of removing a Range Rover from a ditch after a crash

programme.title: Inside the Tower of London
programme.desc: Today, the Tower of London is kept pristinely clean, but it has a dirty past. For centuries, all its rubbish was chucked into the River Thames, but, as chief curator Tracy Borman discovers, yesterday's trash is today's treasure. She joins a team of archaeologists on the foreshore for a once-in-a-decade survey, and makes some remarkable finds, from thousand-year-old pottery to ancient armour

programme.title: Inside the Tower of London
programme.desc: Love is in the air as Yeoman Warder Matt Pryme prepares to marry his sweetheart Jo at the Tower of London. The whole community is getting ready for the big day. While Matt prepares the chapel, Canon Roger Hall chooses his most celebratory vestments

programme.title: Henry VIII: Rise of a Tyrant
programme.desc: Jason Isaacs narrates a drama-documentary revealing the truth about the English monarch, filmed in historic locations including Hampton Court, Windsor Castle. A team of experts on the Tudors uncovers the real Henry, exploring how his complex personality fundamentally shaped the nation

programme.title: 5 News Weekend
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world

programme.title: Argos: How Do They Really Do It?
programme.desc: For decades, Argos has been a fixture of the UK's high streets - seemingly selling everything. This show reveals what really goes on behind the counter at the retail giant

programme.title: Britain's Poshest Farm Shop
programme.desc: Part two of two. This episode celebrates the nation's enduring love of the Great British farm shop and visits four of the most outstanding examples. The one on the Cowdray Estate in West Sussex has gourmet ready meals made by a chef whose CV includes Buckingham Palace, as well as artfully arranged deli displays, and is beloved by both foodie locals and the polo-loving smart set

programme.title: Happy Campers: The Caravan Park
programme.desc: In Looe, Cornwall, Tencreek general manager Rob enters his team into the annual Looe raft race after finishing in a humiliating last place the previous year. He is determined to improve and drafts in food and beverage manager Steve and maintenance man Dion to build an unbeatable craft, while new head of reception Nicky is out to prove that she can be part of the crew

programme.title: A Country Life for Half the Price with Kate Humble
programme.desc: Kate revisits Sam and Lucy Auger-Forbes, who trade in their suburban home in Rochford, Essex, for their very own woodland and a very different life in rural Suffolk. Sam had plans to use the woodland as the centre of a bird photography and bushcraft business, while with Lucy working locally it would mean less time on her stressful commute and more time together as a family with their son Harvey

programme.title: The Motorway
programme.desc: Patrollers Alex and Steve are called in when a horsebox catches fire, while Marissa and her team at the control centre spot a young man on CCTV threatening to jump off a bridge. Elsewhere, Keith and his engineering crew must complete a ¬£7 million resurfacing job over a weekend, but the works are thrown into jeopardy when a state-of-the-art machine breaks down

programme.title: Police Code Zero: Officer Under Attack
programme.desc: Programme exploring the rising number of assaults on police officers, revealing what they face in the line of duty, and the emotional toll these incidents take. On a remote hilltop near Newbury, PC Lucie Gray and Sgt John O'Donovan come under attack after being called to an old hanging post after a report of drunk driving, while in Hyde a suspect bites a police dog and attacks its handler

programme.title: The Transporter (2002)
programme.desc: An underworld courier lives by a simple code - to never ask what he is transporting. However, when he discovers his latest cargo is alive, his conscience gets the better of him and he faces a dangerous game of cat and mouse with his unknown but powerful employers. Action adventure, starring Jason Statham, Shu Qi, Matt Schulze and Francois Berleand

programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors

He also has high blood pressure, so needs to start re-taking his medication to avoid the risk of a stroke in later life. But will he be persuaded to take his medication as directed - and stop smoking?

programme.title: Divine Designs
programme.desc: Cambridge academic Paul Binski continues his fact-finding journey through the history of religious art, visiting St Giles in Cheadle, Staffordshire, and the Free Church in Glasgow to see how Augustus Pugin and Alexander 'Greek' Thomson, two notable Victorian architects, rejected the prevailing industrialism of their era and drew inspiration from the grandeur of the past

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Property expert Ann Maurice offers advice to would-be sellers of a Victorian house in Chester to make it more marketable

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: Reach for the Sky (1956)
programme.desc: Biopic of Second World War hero Douglas Bader. A plane crash in 1931 cost the aspiring pilot both his legs, but after learning to walk on artificial limbs, he went on to become one of the RAF's most decorated heroes. However, more misfortune was in store when he was shot down over occupied France and taken prisoner. Starring Kenneth More, Muriel Pavlow and Alexander Knox

programme.title: Last Train from Gun Hill (1959)
programme.desc: A marshal discovers the man responsible for raping and killing his wife is actually the son of an old friend, setting the scene for a showdown. Western, starring Kirk Douglas, Anthony Quinn, Brian Hutton and Carolyn Jones

programme.title: The Guns of Navarone (1961)
programme.desc: An elite group of Allied soldiers is dispatched to sabotage vital German artillery emplacements, despite the seemingly insurmountable odds and the suspicion there is a traitor in their midst. Oscar-winning Second World War adventure, based on Alistair MacLean's novel, starring Gregory Peck, David Niven, Anthony Quinn, Stanley Baker, Anthony Quayle and Irene Papas

programme.title: My Spy (2020)
programme.desc: Special Forces operative turned spy JJ undertakes covert surveillance of Kate Newton, the sister-in-law of a terrorist. JJ is ordered to keep a low profile. Unfortunately, Kate's resourceful nine-year-old daughter Sophie blows his cover and blackmails JJ into training her as a spy. Comedy, starring Dave Bautista and Chloe Coleman

programme.title: Red Sparrow (2018)
programme.desc: Dominika Egorova, a ballerina struggling to support her ill mother, is recruited to a Russian intelligence service, where she is trained to use her body as a weapon. Her first mission, targeting a CIA agent, threatens to unravel the security of both nations. Spy thriller based on Jason Matthews' novel, starring Jennifer Lawrence, Joel Edgerton, Matthias Schoenaerts and Jeremy Irons

programme.title: Planet Terror (2007)
programme.desc: A disaster at a military base releases a toxic gas on a small town, turning anyone exposed to it into ravenous flesh-eating mutants. A small band of survivors, including a one-legged stripper and a duplicitous bounty hunter, fight their way through the hordes of monsters threatening to overrun the town. Sci-fi thriller, paying homage to low budget B-movies of the 1970s, starring Rose McGowan, Freddy Rodriguez and Josh Brolin

programme.title: Buffalo Soldiers (2001)
programme.desc: American soldier Ray Elwood leads a comfortable life in Cold War Germany, selling everything from cleaning products to heroin on the black market, with his weak-willed commanding officer blissfully unaware. However, everything changes when a tough new sergeant arrives determined to clean up the base, while a profitable arms deal and the new arrival's teenage daughter only complicate matters further. Black comedy drama, with Joaquin Phoenix, Ed Harris, Anna Paquin and Scott Glenn

programme.title: Faintheart (2008)
programme.desc: Family man Richard finds solace from his humdrum life in the world of historical battle re-enactments. However, when his hobby sees him spend more time on the battlefield than at home, his wife leaves him for a gym instructor, forcing Richard to reassess his priorities. Romantic comedy, starring Eddie Marsan, Ewen Bremner, Jessica Hynes, Bronagh Gallagher, Tim Healy and Paul Nicholls

programme.title: Lemony Snicket's A Series of Unfortunate Events (2004)
programme.desc: Three orphans are entrusted into the care of their sinister uncle, a master of disguise who intends to kill them for the family fortune. Quickly realising he is up to no good, the children flee, moving from one prospective guardian to the next - but their wily relative is never far behind. Comedy adventure based on the children's books, starring Jim Carrey, Meryl Streep, Jude Law, Liam Aitken and Emily Browning, with Kara and Shelby Hoffman

However, the presence of three wicked farmers near his woodland home proves a challenge he cannot resist. Stop-motion animated adventure based on the novel by Roald Dahl, with the voices of George Clooney, Meryl Streep, Jason Schwartzman and Bill Murray

programme.title: Entrapment (1999)
programme.desc: An elusive professional art thief suspected of stealing a priceless painting is pursued by an insurance agent. However, instead of bringing the criminal to book, she teams up with him to plot the robbery of a lifetime - although neither is sure the other can be trusted. Crime thriller, starring Sean Connery, Catherine Zeta-Jones, Ving Rhames, Will Patton and Maury Chaykin

programme.desc: An alien arrives on Earth, accompanied by an awesomely powerful robot, on a fateful mission - to decide if the human race deserves to continue - and if not, to wipe it out. The visitor is imprisoned in a military facility, but a scientist helps him escape, hoping to prove that mankind is worth saving. Sci-fi drama remake, starring Keanu Reeves and Jennifer Connelly

programme.title: Desperado (1995)
programme.desc: A mysterious musician carrying a guitar case full of firearms turns up in a small backwoods town to exact revenge on the drugs baron who killed his girlfriend and permanently injured his hand. Robert Rodriguez's action thriller, starring Antonio Banderas, Salma Hayek, Cheech Marin, Joaquim de Almeida, Steve Buscemi and Quentin Tarantino

programme.title: Star Trek: The Motion Picture (1979)

Admiral James T Kirk returns to the bridge of the Enterprise to stop the invader, but he has to contend with a bitter rival and the possession of one of his crew by the alien force. Sci-fi adventure, the first movie based on the TV series, starring William Shatner, Leonard Nimoy, DeForest Kelley and Persis Khambatta

programme.title: Snoopy and Charlie Brown: The Peanuts Movie (2015)

His beloved dog has more important things to worry about, as he dreams of taking to the skies in his airborne kennel. Animated comedy, with the voices of Noah Schnapp and Bill Melendez

However, when he realises what becomes of the honey his species toils so hard to make, he resolves to sue the entire human race for stealing from his fellow creatures. Animated comedy, with the voices of Jerry Seinfeld, Renee Zellweger and Chris Rock

Family sci-fi adventure, starring Josh Hutcherson, Jonah Bobo, Kristen Stewart, Tim Robbins and Dax Shepard

Fact-based comedy drama, starring Matt Damon, Scarlett Johansson and Thomas Haden Church

Sci-fi thriller, inspired by the Isaac Asimov stories, starring Will Smith, Bridget Moynahan and Alan Tudyk

The first of five big-screen action adventures, starring Harrison Ford as Indy, with Karen Allen, Paul Freeman and John Rhys-Davies

Laura Hamilton has three terrific properties in Sussex for Emma's UK budget of ¬£320,000, while Ben Hillman, who has ¬£120,000 to spend, lines up three tempting options in France

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien travel around Britain to find items to fix up and flog on to make a profit for their owners. In this episode, Henry finds a treat for restorer Guy, and Simon creates stunning table lamps from old theatre lights

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Max McMurdo head to Wales to see how can create the most profit on items, including an oil dispenser, fire grate, chaise longue and even a catamaran

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The search for a Kent woman's relatives runs into difficulties on her father's side of the family. The team uncovers the story of a naval hero during a case in Wales

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: Friends of a glamorous south London woman who once travelled the world, call in the probate detectives to try to find her family. Meanwhile, the search for relatives of a silk weaver's son is jeopardised by a surprise revelation. Plus, details of two unclaimed estates where heirs still need to be found

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The latest competition starts at Martyn and Elaine Flint's lovingly decorated, adults-only B&B, the Hillcroft in Torquay. Guests Tony and Lisa find fault with their en suite, while Jorge demonstrates a keen eye for dust. The B&Bers share a lively game of bowls and at dinner, youngsters Sam and Henry's age and experience are subjected to scrutiny. Elaine faces a tough time in the kitchen and the feedback turns up the heat

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to the Guesthouse East in Eastbourne, where Tony and Lisa Partridge hope to impress their guests with their family friendly B&B

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Jorge Mesquita plays host at the Shirley B&B, Bournemouth, where he believes the guests will be impressed by his power showers and hopes a go-karting contest will help him win

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau
programme.desc: The look back at the epic transformation of Dick Strawbridge and wife Angel's 45-room chateau continues, focusing on how Angel's creativity brought the chateau back to life, as walls were smashed, exquisitely designed rooms created and stunning bathroom suites installed

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Nine-year-old Kiya is given the best job ever - choosing a new furry friend out of a litter of three tiny cockapoos. Meanwhile, Wingnut the chihuahua has to prove to 16-year-old Jacob that chihuahuas are indeed cool and overexcited Yorkie Bam Bam needs to chill out if he is going to go home with Londoner Hannah

programme.title: Grand Designs: Living in
programme.desc: In the third of four special programmes, Kevin McCloud reveals how self-builders in the suburbs are transforming this most maligned of residential environments. He draws on some of the best examples from the 15-year history of Grand Designs, talks to experts in the latest architectural thinking and reveals the designs that have reinvented the suburbs as a place where home-owners really can have it all

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Doctors are concerned that a 95-year-old woman may have suffered life-changing injuries to her hip and internal bleeding after falling down a flight of stairs, while the patient's daughter reflects on her mother's optimistic attitude to life's challenges. Elsewhere, a man knocked off his bike at 40mph may have suffered brain damage. His brother remembers a difficult time that brought them closer together

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A nine-year-old boy falls over and lands on his head, and is left unable to move his limbs. As he waits for the results, the boy's father shares his feelings on the challenges of parenthood. Elsewhere, an 80-year-old woman is brought in with a dangerously swollen tongue and a nine-year-old girl is treated after falling off a swing, leaving consultant Rahail considering how the balance of care between parents and children shifts over time

programme.title: I Killed My Husband
programme.desc: After realising the trap that she's in, Anna is confused and in danger of being sucked back into old ways. Caldera arrests Laure and puts her under extensive pressure to gain vital information, while Lucas forces Caldera to listen to him, but can they help Anna? In French

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: In Scotland, Jimmy Doherty finds out how some whisky gets its smoky flavour. In Cyprus, Matt Tebbutt asks why halloumi cheese doesn't melt, and in France, Kate Quilton visits the world's biggest sweetcorn factory to find out how they get corn off the cob so neatly

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Bob and Judith have been married for over 40 years and are now starting out on a new adventure together by buying their dream home, but they can't agree where it should be. Bob loves the rugged coastline of north Norfolk, while Judith prefers the sunny beaches of the northern Costa Blanca, so Laura Hamilton and Jasmine Harman compete to help them reach a decision. Armed with ¬£230,000 in the UK, Laura has hunted out three great options close to the seaside town of Cromer, while in Spain Jasmine has found three amazing properties for her ¬£180,000 budget near Calpe

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Rod and Margaret are selling up in Croydon, south London, to escape the rat race. They plan to split the proceeds, to buy a house in Dorset near the seaside town of Weymouth, and a holiday home in the Dordogne in the south west of France. In both locations, they would love a property with a large garden and fantastic views, with enough space for their six grandchildren to come and visit. Taking on this tough double challenge are Laura Hamilton with a UK budget of ¬£340,000, and Jasmine Harman who has ¬£125,000 to spend in France. They each have three attractive options to show Rod and Margaret

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Sonal and Tina can't wait to give up their busy lives in Birmingham and move to the seaside. Looking for a new permanent home on the stunning Gower Peninsula in Wales and also a holiday bolt-hole on the Greek island of Corfu, they call upon the joint talents of Jonnie Irwin and Laura Hamilton to deliver the double dream. Rising to the challenge, with ¬£385,000 to play with, Jonnie has three great properties to show them in the UK, and for her ¬£150,000 budget Laura has three options up her sleeve in Corfu, but will the couple love any of them enough to put in an offer?

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp catches up with an architect and a glassmaker she helped relocate to the Scottish Borders, where they planned to use their skills developing a house. However, she isn't prepared for the extraordinary progress they've made in the intervening time

programme.title: Car S.O.S.

Charlotte and Meic stumble across the host's messy office, and trouble brews when Ainsley tells Christine that she looks like one of her exes

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Retired French teacher Meic hosts the fourth night of the competition in Llanelli, Carmarthenshire, and plans an authentic French menu including poulet Basquaise. Fellow diner Charlotte makes an impression when she arrives wearing an onion necklace, and the host hopes that his specially branded cremes brulees will impress his guests

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is the final day of the competition in Llanelli, and the turn of teaching assistant Ainsley to host. She wants to educate her guests, while serving an authentic Russian-themed dinner party. programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for the last time to find out what they have been paid and settle some scores. The Edge Accommodation is first, and host John wants to shut the door on some criticism. Next, Sally and Teresa want to challenge John over his comments on their hosting skills

programme.title: The Great British Dig: History in Your Back Garden
programme.desc: Hugh Dennis and the team visit Studley Royal Park in North Yorkshire, on a quest to find the lost Georgian mansion that would have been at the heart of the world class Water Gardens, which still exist today. The house and gardens were created by John Aislabie, but his house has vanished from the landscape and the only clue the team has to go on is a fallen tree that's revealed some mysterious bricks. With the help of the local community, the team uncovers the foundations of this Georgian mansion and finds out about the grand lives of the family who once lived there

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty, Kate Quilton and Matt Tebbutt unveil more secrets about the world of mass-produced food. Jimmy heads to the US to find out how the big chunks in American ice-cream stay so crispy, Kate investigates a rise in olive oil prices and finds a disease wiping out olive trees in southern Italy, and Matt discovers why Bloody Marys are so popular on planes - and why airline food tastes very different at ground level

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: The architect heads off to Italy, where it seems the residents have also been bitten by the 'small buildings are beautiful' bug. The most spectacular place he visits is so high up in the mountains that it's only accessible by helicopter, but this difficulty is more than made up for by the views seen from it. Back in Britain, George meets a man turning a wrecked private jet into a crash pad and a Gypsy tattoo artist with big plans for an old railway carriage. George also challenges his pal, craftsman Will Hardie, to create a woodland retreat for less than the price of a family holiday

programme.title: Ugly House to Lovely House with George Clarke
programme.desc: Tammy and Stuart live in a pretty village in West Sussex but their bungalow is outdated, with its main living rooms starved of light. The couple are desperate to create a family home but their options are severely limited. Enter architect Will Alsop, who designs a dramatic barrel-vaulted extension to the rear of the bungalow, complete with specially constructed exposed curved beams, an aluminium roof and porthole windows. It's certainly an audacious design - but what will the neighbours think?

programme.title: George Clarke's Old House, New Home
programme.desc: George is in Wirral to help retired couple Charles and Ian, who are finally getting round to a complete redesign of their Edwardian home. But will they agree to his radical changes or are they too set in their ways? George also tackles an 1850s country house in Surrey which has accrued some bizarre additions over the years, including a 1970s MDF staircase, a baronial fireplace and a random room that contains nothing but the fuse box

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Dry-cleaning manager Valerie hosts the first dinner party in Lancashire, where she plans to impress her guests with a lamb hotpot and trifle. However, it remains to be seen whether her warm-hearted hospitality will be enough to win her the ¬£1,000 prize by the end of the week

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Dance teacher Nicky hosts the second night in Lancashire, where she hopes to impress her guests with a round-the-world themed menu inspired by her dancing tours, which includes a Chinese salmon starter, and an American dessert. However, with fellow contestant Peggy born in the United States, the host may have her work cut out in presenting the perfect dish

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Outsourcing manager Steve hosts the third night in Lancashire, where the 51-year-old plans to wow his guests with a 'man of the world' menu that relies heavily on strong Indian spices. Peggy picks him up on his shop-bought black pudding, while Nicky is unimpressed by the mildness of the chicken balti, resulting in a humiliating chilli-sauce challenge

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: American Peggy hosts a USA-themed dinner party on the fourth night of the competition in Lancashire, and hopes her Arizonan recipes will be enough to win her the ¬£1,000 prize. Her menu comprises tried and tested dishes, including her dessert of peach dump cake. However, friction between her and fellow contestant Steve continues to build

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is the final dinner party in Lancashire, and the turn of sales manager Andy to host. He is confident in his locally sourced gastro menu and delivers a meal with plenty of flair, but faces the challenge of impressing foodie Nicky. He is also under pressure to convince American Peggy of the merits of the region's food, while his fellow Lancastrians Valerie and Steve are keen to see how the area has influenced his cooking

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at Church Street Cobbles, a B&B that foodie Debbie Quinn and housekeeper, cook and cleaner Isobel Reisen recently opened above a barber shop in Macclesfield. Guests John and Joy are amazed by the cleanliness, but Steve and Verity aren't impressed with their bathroom. During an afternoon of foraging in the woods, Debbie and Isobel get competitive, while Arun and his sister Rashmi show off their skills. Expectations are high at breakfast, but Debbie's locally sourced produce comes under fire from Steve and Verity, and their feedback is hard to swallow

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to rock 'n' roll venue the Victoria Bikers Pub in Coalville, Leicestershire, where siblings John and Joy take a more laid back approach to running the business

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to the Cranberries Hideaway in Kilmington, Devon, where owner Steve and his partner Verity hope the luxury touches will win over their guests

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The guests head to the Mehfil Hotel in Southall, London, where spiritual host Arun and his sister Rashmi are hoping to bring some Indian hospitality to the competition

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for one last time to find out what they have been paid. Debbie and Isobel are keen to get to the bottom of some of the cleaning comments from Steve and Verity

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Business manager Alison Bennett hosts the first dinner party in Glasgow, where she hopes that her Thai menu of chicken satay, red-roasted pork and chili chocolate combs will help to secure her the ¬£1,000 prize. However, it remains to be seen whether any of her guests are able to use the chopsticks she has provided

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Butcher Graeme Curley hosts the second night in Glasgow, where he has planned a meaty menu complete with pork ribs. He hopes to wow his guests by serving steak - and by bringing some of his trade to the dinner table

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Hairdresser Michelle Blackett is the host on day three in Glasgow, and hopes to impress the diners by preparing a menu of exceedingly well-appointed food. Over the course of the evening, Michelle's guests discover her hidden heritage, and hospitality student Erwin - who speaks five languages - does his best to add the 'Glaswegian' dialect to his arsenal

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Ballet enthusiast and hospitality management student Erwin Orduz hosts the fourth dinner party in Glasgow and hopes to impress his guests with an evening of shocks and surprises. He attempts hotel-style presentation and serves up his meals in a dining room that has been decorated with a menagerie theme of animals and nakedness

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Yvonne Finlayson hosts the final night of the cooking competition in Glasgow, offering her guests a combination of 'scientifically-infused' food, high-octane entertainment and scintillating chat - plus a healthy dose of revelations - to try to claim the ¬£1,000 prize

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: A category one call comes through for a man bleeding from his ears. But how he got these injuries doesn't ring true for the paramedics. A woman who's recently had bowel surgery is losing blood and needs to go to hospital urgently. A patient is struggling to breathe, but didn't tell her husband as she didn't want to worry him, and now she needs an emergency response

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A 74-year-old man is brought in after being found in a confused state by his son. Doctors discover signs of a brain injury, leading his children to reveal the tragedy that befell their father and the shattering effect it has had on his life. A woman who fell down the stairs at her granddaughter's 16th birthday is also in need of treatment, and her daughter is reminded of a phone call that changed their lives forever. Meanwhile, in paediatrics, a talkative nine-year-old is treated for a rash on his ankle

programme.title: The Emergency Ward
programme.desc: Dr Michelle and Dr Emma are on high alert for a mother-to-be who is partly paralysed and unresponsive from a suspected stroke. Dr Bjorn and Dr Martin's critically injured patient clings to life after a camper trailer rolled over him

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: The air ambulance teams are called out to help Dennis, who's suffering a heart attack. A spin on her bike has catastrophic consequences for Carolyn. Plus, there's a dramatic night-time car crash in Norfolk

programme.title: The Good Doctor
programme.desc: Shaun suspects a patient is lying about the reason for her injury and makes a controversial assumption about her motives. Neil's personal life could be affecting his work

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: A category one call comes through for a man bleeding from his ears. But how he got these injuries doesn't ring true for the paramedics. A woman who's recently had bowel surgery is losing blood and needs to go to hospital urgently. A patient is struggling to breathe, but didn't tell her husband as she didn't want to worry him, and now she needs an emergency response

programme.title: Lazy Boy Garage
programme.desc: The Lazy Boys track down a rare and well-preserved Opel Kadett to turn into a rally car, but have to change their plans when the car arrives from Spain

programme.desc: A grand tour of the Ferrari Roma production facility in Northern Italy. Titch lifts the lid on an icon of the 1960s - the series one Jaguar E-type

programme.title: Border Force: America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: Documentary with unrestricted access to America's Customs and Border Protection working on the bridges that separate Texas and Mexico, following the work of the many officers who police the bridges and keep America safe. In the first episode, a shipment of cardboard packaging hides a deadly secret, and heroin disguised as a laptop baffles the world's most advanced narcotic detection device

programme.title: Survivor Australia
programme.desc: Sam and Chrissy lament that all the hard work voting out Shay, Jordie and KJ was wasted when they re-enter the game

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK

programme.title: Border Force: America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: Meth is found inside a truck driver's speakers, a Mexican boy claiming US citizenship is questioned, and AC units containing drugs are intercepted.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson drives the Jaguar F-Type sports car on some of Britain's finest roads, while Richard Hammond jumps inside the Range Rover Sport and gives it a thorough workout off-road, on a track and in what he believes is its most natural habitat - the lanes of Cheshire. James May goes for a countryside adventure in the New Routemaster London bus brought into use in 2013, which is propelled by a turbodiesel generator and a powerful electric motor. Inspired by the machines they have tested, the trio then meet to celebrate Britain's motor industry with a grand finale in front of Buckingham Palace. Plus, former Formula One driver Mark Webber takes to the track for a lap in the Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May immerse themselves in nostalgia and try to prove that hot hatches from their younger days are better than today's equivalents. Jeremy grabs the keys to a Volkswagen Golf GTI, Richard takes the wheel of a Vauxhall Nova SRi and James May opts for the Ford Fiesta XR2i, and the trio set off on a road trip that includes a hill climb and a visit to a supermarket. However, their adventure concludes at an army training ground in Wales, where they and their steeds must face the heavily armed Top Gear Police Department. Downton Abbey star Hugh Bonneville blasts the Reasonably Priced Car around the test track

programme.title: Lazy Boy Garage
programme.desc: Jonny thinks he can turn a profit on the relatively unknown Seat 600 and purchases one from Barcelona, as the Lazy Boys try to tap into the market for bubble cars

programme.title: Lazy Boy Garage
programme.desc: Jonny Smith finds an Austrian Ford Cortina Mk4, known in Europe as the Taunus, but the Lazy Boys need to decide whether to replace its rare engine

programme.title: Rick Stein's Road to Mexico
programme.desc: The chef continues down the Californian coastline immortalised by John Steinbeck, a region of citrus groves and vineyards. On the edge of Los Angeles, Rick discovers Olvera Street, where the Hispanic origins of the city took root. Then heading south to San Diego, he meets 79-year-old Peter Halmay, the oldest sea-urchin diver in town, and is served the best fish chilli he has ever had by a local fishmonger

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee Mack and Sally Bretton star in the domestic comedy which sees the couple appear to go from one disaster to the next, while coping with their three kids, Lucy's disapproving parents, Lee's feckless dad Frank and their world-weary friends Toby and Anna. This week the couple become addicted to a TV box set, causing them to cancel dinner with Toby and Anna at the last moment. But when they lie about the reason, it only succeeds in opening up a huge can of worms. Domestic comedy, with Hugh Dennis and Abigail Cruttenden

programme.title: Mortimer & Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
programme.desc: Paul Whitehouse and Bob Mortimer return to Scotland for their latest fishing trip. Having failed to catch a salmon in the River Tay, they hope to have more luck on the Tweed. They also try their hand at boat fishing and receive some mystical predictions from a familiar face

programme.title: Mortimer & Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
programme.desc: Paul Whitehouse and Bob Mortimer are joined by Feargal Sharkey for a trip to the River Lea in Hertfordshire, where Paul used to fish for perch with his friends when he was a teenager. Bob reads up on the wise words of 17th-century angler Izaak Walton and prepares a riverside picnic that brings back fond memories and leads to a reflection on the differences between teenage life in their 1970s youth and the present. Setting up home in a narrowbooat, he also prepares a dish Paul's mother used to make - corned beef and potato pie

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson gets behind the wheel of the Ferrari F12 Berlinetta, sampling the punch of its 730bhp V12 engine on the open roads of Scotland. Richard Hammond harnesses the power of motorsport on a quest to find the world's best taxi, and James May pays tribute to the former BBC Television Centre in White City, London, using a motorcyclist and a pair of parkour runners. Plus, the BAC Mono - an astonishingly fast car with just one seat - is put through its paces on the test track, and film director Ron Howard goes for a spin in the new Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The three motoring enthusiasts head to Spain on a mission to help its struggling economy - but the convertible supercars they take are very expensive and anything but discreet. With Jeremy Clarkson in a McLaren MP4-12C, Richard Hammond driving a Ferrari 458 and James May behind the wheel of an Audi R8 V10, the trio encounter mountain passes, empty towns and an abandoned airport before creating their own street circuit in a deserted Madrid development. Plus, Sherlock star Benedict Cumberbatch sets a lap time in the Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Top Gear: From A-Z
programme.desc: John Bishop narrates an alphabetical romp through the series' most memorable stunts and features as former hosts Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May pushed vehicles of all shapes and sizes to their limits. With 22 seasons of the show, there was no shortage of material to choose from as the likes of Tom Cruise and Cameron Diaz attempted to be the fastest Star in a Reasonably Priced Car, and the presenters risked life and limb in their assorted globe-trotting adventures

programme.desc: A driver is stopped attempting to smuggle 15kg of cocaine across the border, and a truck driver's modified cab attracts attention at the World Trade Bridge

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: Tom Allen is the host for the first in a new run of stand-up showcases, performed in front of a live audience at London's world-famous Hammersmith Apollo. Each show features sets from two of the country's most acclaimed up-and-coming comedians, and this week it is Rosie Jones and Kae Kurd taking to the stage. Performers set to appear in this series include Sindhu Vee, Alex Edelman, Lou Sanders, Darren Harriott, Jessica Fostekew, Stephen Bailey, Desiree Burch, Paul McCaffrey, Jonny Pelham, Ardal O'Hanlon, Sara Barron, Mawaan Rizwan, Guz Khan, Kiri Pritchard-McLean, Rhys James, Sarah Pascoe, Chris McCausland and Flo & Joan

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Richard Hammond visits Abu Dhabi's Yas Marina circuit to drive the Porsche 918 Spyder, a four-wheel-drive hybrid hypercar capable of astonishing speeds thanks to the 886 horsepower it can generate from its screaming V8 petrol engine and electric motors. Jeremy Clarkson and James May join forces to create a public information film to promote safer cycling, with their efforts presented to a panel of experts including members of Westminster Council and Olympic gold medal-winning rider Chris Boardman. Meanwhile, Jeremy - who has promised to change his name to Jennifer if the Porsche is faster around the test track than the McLaren P1 driven earlier in the series - compares the seventh-generation Volkswagen Golf GTI to BMW's critically acclaimed M135i. Breaking Bad star Aaron Paul fires up the Reasonably Priced Car to see what lap time he can achieve

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Extended edition. Question master Stephen Fry continues the comedy panel quiz's exploration of subjects beginning with the letter L as he asks a range of fiendish questions about lenses, lungs and legs. With comedian and The Last Leg co-host Josh Widdicombe, comedienne Jo Brand, Never Mind the Buzzcocks team captain and stand-up Phill Jupitus and regular panellist Alan Davies

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: Lister yearns for intelligent conversation with people he actually likes, but with only Rimmer for company, he is forced to take desperate action - sitting the chef's exam. Sci-fi comedy, starring Chris Barrie, Craig Charles and Norman Lovett

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: Rimmer is sent into a frenzy of scientific research when Holly recovers an unidentified pod floating in space, which the hologram is convinced is of alien origin. Comedy, starring Chris Barrie, Danny John-Jules, Craig Charles and Norman Lovett

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: Lister comes down with a mutated strain of pneumonia that makes his feverish hallucinations come to life. programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: Lister and the Cat are horrified when Rimmer duplicates himself, but their shock turns to hilarity when the identically petty pair move in together, only to find they are not very well matched. Chris Barrie, Craig Charles and Danny John-Jules star

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: Tom Allen is the host for the first in a new run of stand-up showcases, performed in front of a live audience at London's world-famous Hammersmith Apollo. Each show features sets from two of the country's most acclaimed up-and-coming comedians, and this week it is Rosie Jones and Kae Kurd taking to the stage. programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: A look at how corruption became rife within the SS, with the money stolen from Jews finding its way into the pockets of the camp guards rather than funding the war effort. Many of the SS also enjoyed illicit sexual relationships with female prisoners. Meanwhile, Dr Mengele embarked on a gruesome series of experiments, using children as guinea pigs in his research into genetic inheritance

programme.desc: The story of an RAF pilot with incredible night vision, which supposedly came from eating carrots. Plus, rebels in the Philippines who believed they were fighting a vampire

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo examines the history of the American rail network, using Appleton's General Guide to the United States and Canada of 1879 to plot his course. He begins on Manhattan Island and travels from Grand Central Terminal to the site of Ground Zero

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels between Liverpool and Wales. Along the way he discovers a childhood favourite - a miniature tank engine with three carriages in dark red - made by Frank Hornby, and learns the story of a Welsh countess who lived in Gwrych Castle. In Snowdonia, he also rides the waves with a Welsh surfing champion

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: In picturesque Snowdonia, Michael Portillo braves the fastest zip line in the world - stretching 1,500 feet across a vast slate quarry as he begins the last leg of his journey to Caernarfon. En route, he also visits the home of British mountaineering, Pen y Gwryd, to hear how an Edwardian journalist and poet created a climbing community, which grew to include men who would conquer Everest in the 1950s

programme.title: Bangers & Cash
programme.desc: Derek gets a tour of Hadlow Castle in Kent when he arrives to collect the owner's pre-war Alvis and an immaculate Citroen used by the Gestapo in occupied France

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: The events of 1944, when the death toll rose substantially. By this point, the Allies were aware of Auschwitz's purpose, and faced a difficult decision over what should be done about it. Plus, the story of the occupation of Hungary, revealing how Adolf Eichmann offered to spare a million Jews in return for certain services

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on the second leg of his journey from Preston to Kirkcaldy, returning to the historic Settle-Carlisle line he helped save from dereliction when he was Minister of State for Transport in the 1980s. Here, engineer Tony Feshini describes what life was like for the people who originally built Ribblehead Viaduct, before Michael visits Dent, Cumbria, home to the highest railway station in England

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey following George Bradshaw's footsteps, as the third leg of his trip from Preston to Kirkcaldy sees him embarking on a two-day tour of the Lake District. He begins in Windermere, where he travels by steamboat to the north of the lake, and continues to Claife viewing station, where he learns about the water pollution caused by increasing levels of tourism. He spends the night in Grasmere, and the following day reaches Kendal, where he buys local delicacies and meets a farmer who explains the impact of railways on farming practices

programme.desc: Preparations are under way for Yorkshire Day, including a special Yorkshire-themed Pullman service, with Gill and husband Paul getting hands-on sorting out the event. There is also another big occasion on the horizon and Tim is organising the wedding of head boilersmith Mark and his equally steam-mad fianc√©e Emma. Their love blossomed because of mutual passion for steam, and in particular the B1, so they want the engine to pull them on their wedding train, but issues with the engine means it might miss the big day

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo arrives at a milestone on his American journey as he reaches the boundary between the northern and southern states, known as the Mason-Dixon line. Beginning in Wilmington, North Carolina, he uncovers the history of gunpowder production in Delaware, before heading to Baltimore, where he discovers how the first American steam engine owed a lot to British technology. On the city's east coast, Michael visits the star-shaped Fort McHenry, and learns how the Star-Spangled Banner national anthem was born
